content:
r 22, 2015
												I gave  2K15 a good review and that was after a couple Patches that made the game usable. 2K16 came around and it's the same engine, basically the same game but with a ton more flaws and issues and i don't know how that is even possible. I mean in 2K15 for example the Lakers had their real arena light, that means, all the lights on court while the crowd area is darkend. In 2K16 it's the same bright lit arena like everywhere.But that's just one of the more superficial flaws this game has. So far i encountered:  - During Games the commentators stop working, that was a problem in 2K15 but is even worse here now with the commentators stop all the time, in every match be it a mycareer match, a online match, myteam match, all the time- Sound effects and Music also stop, you play one match in Mypark with the Music, all sound effects and the next match you only have the sound effects of Park itself, like the Bird and Sea sounds on the Park or the Steel mill sounds on the Rough Riders Park but you won't hear the players, the ball or anything else.Now of course one could argue that sound is just one thing but there are many other problems- Invisible players, that happens everywhere be it the park or an offline game, sometimes player get invisible but they still play, making points and everything- You get fouled out (6 fouls) but you can still play- Players shoot at the wrong hoop (happens with the AI)- AI players don't know how to behave and resemble more a bunch of scared chickensThere are more issues all around, i have a screenshot of the Store where rings are displayed as pants, that's not fixed one month later. - Random crashes, unable to invite friends, connection problems, disconnections in the MyPark, connection errors (including crash to desktop) on MyCourt when you invite friends do exist. 2K's servers are notoriously bad and have been bad for the past few years over console generations and now on the PC. It's baffling they don't fix their crap which leads me to the next point: - Microtransactions. With 2K15 2K introduced  VC to the game, you earn VC by playing matches, be it online, mycareer, mypark or whatever which you can invest in shoes, jerseys, shorts or use on the MyTeam mode as with always, microtransactions on a game that costs 50€ (at least, the MJ edition was 69,99€) is questionable, while you can earn them, you can buy them with real money and 2K this year made sure you can't get enough VC without paying for them. MyTeam has Card Packs that cost 7.500 VC, there are shoes up to 15.000 VC, Jerseys up to 5.000 VC and regardless if you unlock shoe contracts or not, the shoes you design yourself in the main menu outside the career cost you 7.500 VC, regardles of a shoe contract and if you want to proudly display the jersey of your team you play in career in the online park you need to get to a certain park reputation and on top of it, the jersey is another 5.000 VC. Last year those Team Jerseys in the Park were free, now even for that 2K wants your money. The positive things, are the new things: Team relocation in MyGM and MyLeague are fun and in MyTeam you can use the same features about getting your own Logo (better make sure to not use any trademarked stuff becuase apparently even using and old Team logo that is not available can get you banned and the game only supplies you with the regular 30 NBA Team Logos, despite having classic logos and jerseys available in MyTeam but you're not allowed to use them in MyGM/MyLeague, so you can upload them yourself but you risk getting banned because it is actually a breach of their TOS)Speaking of MyTeam, it's a grind through hundreds of the same cards and the same old challenges, in fact, it was a lot more fun last year where you could chose between Current and Classic Team Packs, now you only have 3 current packs and at the moment a Rookie Card Pack that can net you anything from a rookie to a silver to an amethyst card pack but most of the time you get the same guys over and over, i got 3 times the same blake griffin rookie of the year card. It's like the game is trolling you and just wants you to waste your MT Points or VC on crap. Talking about that i want to mention more bugs people had: - No Keyboard support, while i think playing a sports game on Keyboard (i haven't done that since FIFA 96 personally) is kinda dumb, i think a PC game should support the Keyboard. NBA 2K16 doesn't really, you can't configure keys and the pre-made layout is apparently made for aliens with 3 arms and several more fingers- In MyCareer you might receive MyTeam Cards through connections...at least that's the theory. I unlocked a few, never got the cards- Same with the rival day on MyPark, the second week me and some friends helped the Sunset Beach securing a victory and despite constant "Claim your reward on the kiosk" messages, we never got the promised VC and reduction of Boosts. And now we come to the big hype this year: Livin' da Dream - A Spike Lee JointThe premise is actually fun: You start in High School, play College and then go to the NBA. Certainly better than the "Not getting drafted story from last year" but: You can't really customize your player, you are from Harlem, your nickname is Frequency Vibrations, shortened to Freq and you're basically forced to create a black player because otherwise it's absurd to have black parents and a black twin sister. So you start in High School which consists of 3 games followed by College (you can select 1 of 9 colleges but it makes no real change at all) which lasts for 4 Games and after than you're in the NBA, after you got drafted your rookie season consists of 8 games (and 1 playoff match, if you're lucky) while the rest is simulated. The game actually acts like you should have a choice, like teasing a decision about wether you do a second college year or go straight to the NBA or later "state your oppinion about your shoes" which was mistaken by many to be a shoe deal which it isn't, it's just cutscenes you have no influences whatsoever and most of those scenes drag on for too long (some are over 10 minutes) and you sit there and wonder "is this a badly written movie or am i still playing a game?" only to realize "i'm stuck in a badly written story full of cliche, annoying (and sometimes racist) characters and plot holes (like your player constantly switching between a 3 time and a 4 time all-american) in a game full of bugs that make me play matches for the sake of seeing more stupid soap opera like cutscenes"Once your after the rookie season you start MyCareer but it's still not your Career as mentioned above, you can select a "secondary nickname" but the PA and the Announcers as well as the Pre- and Post-Game Show still call you Freq all the time. It's highly annoying. I could go on and on with the flaws, how 2KTV makes the game crash at random times in the main menu, the performance is abysmal because it's a very badly optimized game, how disconnections, crashes, glitches and limitations hinder everything and 2K doesn't care and of course how the online mode is filled with cheater on the park or the obnoxious ce-quitters in myteam and of course that even the music while being a great diverse soundtrack with various styles and some truly great songs is censored to the point where songs consist of mostly audio drop outss, the worst example being NAS - Made you Look which is so horribly butchered that the finaly 10 seconds only consist of the word spit because everything else is erased because it contains "filthy words". So all in all, while the basis of the game is still a good basketball game, it has too many bugs, glitches, flaws, cheaters with 2K apprently only caring about saving their precious microtransactions and nothing else. So all i can say, is: Don't buy the game and don't support 2K because they simply don't care.

content:
r 1, 2015
												Before I go into the gameplay, let's address the elephant in the room. Spike Lee's My Career. I have a big problem with being forced to be black for the story to make sense. Not because there's anything bad about being black (full disclosure: I'm a black man), but because its lazy writing. Spike seems to want to tell his story of a struggling black kid from Harlem, New York making it to the NBA. That's great for a movie, but this is supposed to be a game. And the best games give the player the most choices. Choices are why Western RPGs like Dragon Age:Inquisition & Skyrim are more popular right now than Japanese RPGs that force you to play through a bunch of set pieces as their stock protagonist. I'm opposed to any game mode that removes choice from players, especially when those choices existed in last year's game.With that out of the way, NBA 2K16's gameplay has improved over the past two iterations. Defense is more effective & physical. You can't just bully your way into the post with a random SF anymore. Shot selection seems to be even more important this year & fastbreaks actually seem fast this year. The 2K Shop, however, is another matter. They're selling virtual Gatorade now?!? C'mon man...that's just a blatant cash grab. Everything costs VC this year. Designing your court would be great if they didn't nickel & dime you to death for accessories. I know that you can earn some things through My Career, but its still ridiculous to charge 500 VC for different colored nets.Overall, I enjoy the gameplay more than ever. But 2K needs to stop letting outsiders write stories for games & be a bit less greedy next year. Pick this up now if you're absolutely addicted to sports games. Otherwise, catch it on the next Steam sale.

ber 27, 2015
												When you play NBA2k most like the Story mode, NBA2k knew that so they brought in somebody who knows Basketball and how to put together a good story, Spike Lee. This game proved to me that my assumptions about Spike Lee were correct. He cant write a good story, the only city in this mans mind is New York, and there is only 1 race in Spikes world, Black. If you enjoy personal player customization, than this game is NOT for you. Pike Lee stereotyped this game all over the place, if your Asian, Russian, White, Mexican, etc, than im sorry, but according to this game, your now African American, but you can choose what shade of African American, so thats good I guess. There is only 1 voice for your charactor. If you try to make your charactor look as much like another ethnic group as possible, you then have to deal with the fact you have a black family, which is fine, I can do the adopted thing, but wait, you have a twin sister who is also black. Now, your name, you'd probably like to have your very own name wouldnt you, too bad, you are now known as "Freq", which is short for Frequency Vibrations. Oh ya, you live in the projects in Harlem, nowhere else, you cant choose LA, Houston, Canada, London, nope, its Harlem. Your best friend is a drugged out loud mouth, your sister wont give you any privacy. How about choosing a college to goto, that you can do, aslong as your favorite school is 1 of the 8 they give you to choose from. Now, im not saying thoe entire game is junk, its not, infact the only part of the game thats junk is the MyCareer mode, all the other aspects of the game are fine. Well, except for those who pre-ordered the game and didnt get what was promised for those who pre-ordered, ugh!

content:
ber 29, 2015
												Much was made about the Spike Lee directed Career/Story Mode but I found it really lacking and hugely disappointing. The biggest problem I have with this was the absolute heavy-ham-handed scripting which instead of adding to immersion actually kills it completely.Firstly, My Career has always been about creating a player that is you (or that you want) regardless of race. Spike Lee pigeon-holes and shoe-horns you into poor black kid growing up in the projects in Harlem. Cliched much?My Career tries to present two of the fundamental choices/problems that blue-chip college/young NBA players have: such as whether or not to go one-and-done; whether or not to stick with your homie who's had your back forever but is a bad influence or to ditch him for the good of your career.So much is made about these problems and how hard it is to choose. Your character literally agonizes over each choice. Then the game/story goes ahead and makes the choices for you. Well duh ... if you're going to belabour the point and make it such a big deal, and if it really is MY career, then I would like to have a say in it, wouldn't you? I honestly only started enjoying the game a bit more after the script ended. Also another pet peeve is the big deal they make of your created player: high school phenom, blue-chip prospect, once in a generation talent, etc, etc. And you come into the draft with a skill level of 55? This may not be a big deal (and actually fit with the last edition where your player went undrafted) but the disparity is so immersion-breaking. From having 'boosted' stats in High School/College where your 7 foot centre can literally hit 3-pointers from everywhere to missing 2 feet lay-ups in the NBA ... i should think that if I'm actually good enough to be drafted top-20 in the NBA draft i should be at least be able to make a jump-shot or two.Also, because of whatever reason, your rookie season is abridged into eight games so that Spike Lee can turn your rookie career into a blurb. Which means you only play 8 games (i.e. compared to the regular season 82 you would have played in previous editions - meaning you literally miss out one entire year of skill points and never have a chance to break into the starting line-up). It also means the whole Rookie of the Year target which most players set their sights on is pretty much impossible/redundent.   Game-wise its generally more of the same with better animations. A more robust blocking/swatting system is much welcome. But generally the AI appears to be more tepid and less intelligent this edition. The point-guard hogs the ball way too much and makes really bad decisions/shots. The transition game appears better and fast breaks are a lot more viable but the PC-controlled teams appear to have a huge edge in the transition game (most of the time your team are not even back in their half-court set when the other team pushes the ball back up the court for an empty lane). tldr: Spike Lee's story kills the immersion and the real game/fun only starts when it ends. They should have made the story-mode a toggle on/off feature when starting a new career. I feel that 2k15 plays a little better and is more immersive.

content:
ber 26, 2015
												This review is mainly slated towards MyCareer.It's really upsetting, I played a lot of NBA 2K15 and after spending a majority of time finishing MyCareer and MyGM/MyLeague, I definitely got my money's worth after 300+ hrs. NBA 2K16, however, got pretty overhyped when regards to their MyCareer, which seemingly got worse.I think most people were under the impression that after all the positive feedback 2K14 and 2k15 got in regards to MyCareer, and how they enjoy a story around your character, 2k would finally go all out with one this year by hiring Spike Lee to direct it.Somehow, they went backwards. Even though 2k never had a white voice actor, hiring Spike Lee to be a ghetto visionary and make your family black and growing up in Harlem sort of ruins any illusion that most of the white players could relate to, which btw, alot of your audience is.As for the customization people were hoping for, it some how becomes even more linear with Spike Lee making a strict storyline with choices you can not choose. Literally, the only choices you can make in MyCareer is Choosing a High School (1 of 3), choosing a college (1 of 9), and at the end of 8 games played (of 82) you get to become a free agent. Meaning if you wanted to play the 2015-2016 league, you only are playing 8 games against the legitimate rosters, and then enter free agency.How did this happen? Outside of actual games, MyCareer lasted a total of maybe an hour. After completeing college and moving into the draft, Im finally in the NBA, next to top draft picks that have overalls of 78 and 77, meanwhile I have 55 overall and am somehow considered a top 10 pick. Where's summer league? Training camp? Where is anything that can allow me to actually progress without having to spend VC on attributes ? Most people do NOT want to start the NBA with 55 overall and don't want to have to spend money on VC to stay competitive.As for what they did right, High School and College felt legitimately realistic. You're a high school phenom, and as such your character is seriously OP. You can steal and run the ball and shoot better than everyone, and as you progress towards the NBA, games get harder in college. Unfortunately there was no real culture to talk about with colleges, the only differences is the uniform and logo, and High School + College combined are over very quickly.Edit: More time put into MyCareer and gameplay is still solid, and now that the mediocre story is over, the grind for getting badges and practicing in the gym is actually enjoyable. Connections would be more interesting if they were more indepth and you weren't able to exploit them, but overall a nice addition. Still disappointing overall.Another annoying thing to point out is the fact that during creating MyPlayer, while height and wingspan actually matter in this version of 2k ( which is a good thing ), the fact that choosing inside/outside/balanced position when creating your character limits your possibility as a player, and can't be changed. As a balanced 6'6 SF with maxed shooting, my 3 pt is below average that of another SF in the league.

content:
ber 26, 2015
												Having pre-ordered NBA 2K16 (following the hype train, woot-woot!), I got the opportunity to play already, and I was able to quickly form an opinion on the in my eyes most important mode of the game, the MyCareer mode. I’m one of those who basically bought the game for this mode alone, where you take control of a new player in the NBA and lead him to greatness.By now, I’ve played three quarters of my rookie season, after leading my player through high school and first year of college. I’m blown away by how much of a blowout this game is. “Hold it right there for a second,” you might say, “the game isn’t out long enough for you to have played so far ahead!” If I didn’t know better, I would agree with you on that. The problem is, however, your “rookie season” is 8 (eight!) games long.Yes, you’ve read right. I was shocked when I got to the “gym menu” and read that it was the first of eight games I would get to play in my rookie season. It’s frustrating. The game doesn’t give you any option to change this. This is not a basketball simulation anymore, it’s a farce.I want to lead my player through all 82 games of a season (plus even more in post-season, if possible), and in full-length at that. Maybe I don’t get much further than my rookie season until the next game comes out, but I’m with my player all the way until then. When the commentators praise my last game, I want to have been there for that. Why should I give a damn about what the AI made my player do? I don’t get any credits for that to spend on my abilities, I don’t get any chance to rise to starhood early on, and I don’t get any sort of information how I’m doing outside of the commentary for the next game I’m playing, or at least I haven’t found it in the cryptic menu structure.“Featuring a Spike Lee joint” is the worst thing they could’ve done. You’re forced to suffer through one of the most annoying stories I’ve ever played. And I’ve been through all of “Dying Light”. They praise it in the trailers with “Be The Story”. Guess what, that’s all you get to do, because you can’t make one on your own.I didn’t know what to expect, so my player is pretty much me. Every NBA 2K game I’ve played before gave me the opportunity to “be myself”, which mostly meant, a white guy with a similar name (so the commentators don’t just call me by my nickname) and “College” Germany (and a different height, depending on the position). In 2K16, that means a 7ft tall (Center) white guy has a black twin sister that seems at least a foot smaller, has no similarities in their looks whatsoever, and stays bland throughout the story, a problem all characters have in this. You don’t get to choose anything about yourself beside the appearance and some on-court details. Everything but the teams you play for is pretty much set in stone; and the teams you play for do not change the story a bit. You follow a story of some random dude, instead of forming him yourself. There are some major crossroads he just barrels through without you being consulted. But hey, you can choose to go to UCLA instead of UConn. Congratulations.Even when you think you can choose something important (what a heated discussion in a cut scene about staying another year in College or agreeing to enter the Draft builds up to), he just says, “here’s what I’m going to do…”, cut to black screen, and whoop-de-do, welcome to the NBA Draft 2016!I feel no connection to Harlem. I feel no connection to the family. Suddenly I have a girlfriend, and I have no idea why she’s here (when I first saw her, I was like “Hey, who’s that? Oh, she looks nice, and she’s in an important meeting… she might be my girlfriend. Oh her name’s Yvette? Cool.”). My so-called best friend is always up to no good and I spend six-figure sums in lawyers and settlements to keep everything quiet about him and his escapades. My agent (who I obviously don’t get to choose, either) is a New Yorker, a self-proclaimed “Shark” with italian roots, where every “Mobster cliche” bell in my head starts ringing like a shot clock. I have no say in this at all. The story tries very hard to create drama (to the point where it’s hard for me to suspend my disbelief), but it fails miserably at making me care, because it lacks decisions where my actions would have any sort of impactful consequences. If this was a movie, I wouldn’t see it in theatres, I wouldn’t rent it, and wouldn’t even waste my time on it would it be on Netflix.Technically, the game is up to snuff concerning the simulation part, even though I despise getting fouled out in the third quarter because of the mechanics for setting picks (and for calling illegal screens). Otherwise, it’s ridiculously bad. The menu structure is horrible, you don’t find anything quickly. A training option where you get to train the moves one by one is completely missing, instead you get four instructional videos with instructions read by NBA stars who can muster about as much enthusiasm as if they were reading a recipe for sour cream cheesecake - or dubbing a 70s sex ed video. In the few hours I’ve played, I’ve had about half a dozen Back-To-Desktop crashes, without the game freezing (it just closed the window). Other than that, the servers aren’t the most reliable, but that might be because the game isn’t even officially released yet. Oh god, I dread what it will be like in the week following the official release...Graphically, it looks very good, but that’s to be expected. There isn’t much more to improve graphically, anyway. Last year’s NBA 2K looked great, too. My PC isn’t the best out there, but it manages to give a decent image.UPDATE: As one of the comments so helpfully pointed out, the game "reverses back to normal" in the second season. The so-called "story" only ruins your rookie year, but oh boy is it bad, and cheesy, tacky, and all sorts of wrong. I write fanfiction for a hobby and I would've been able to write a better story on a tipsy saturday evening. After now going strong in my second season, the game does get better; but I still can't bring myself to recommend it, most of all not at full price. You lose the probably most important season of your career to a joke of a story.Bugwise, it's playable, although for me there's one recurring thing: it has a kinda useful feature telling you things about your opponent when you come into the game (at tipoff or from the bench), but sometimes it fails to load that overview (only showing the player in idle animation), and the game takes about 20 sec to skip that screen and go back into the game.TL;DR: It’s not a bad game, per say, and perhaps you’ll find joy in it if you don’t care about the MyCareer mode, but in that mode, it dumps all its negative points right in my face early on although I usually like the NBA 2K franchise. I will continue playing it at least until after my rookie season, and maybe pick it up again once they bring me a patch that fixes this abomination called “Featuring A Spike Lee Joint”. Until then, keep away from this because no way this is worth the full price.TL;DR: UPDATE: Got to second season. Story over, so game got better. Rookie season still ruined. Don't buy at full price.

content:
er 24, 2015
												Been playing NBA2k games since 2k12 and I've noticed this year is pretty ridiculous. I generally play MyCareer as it is the most popular game mode, but I do occassionally play the others.Pros:- The game looks great visually- Easy to adapt to new controls- Harder to do certain things that wasn't exactly basketball-like that older games had- Overall very smooth with decent cpuCons:- MyCareer is a racist joke: I ain't black so why is my twin sister black. Stereotypes everywhere. Spike Lee was the worst part about this game.- Not new user friendly: Be ready to throw your wallet to get any sort of decent start because your mycareer starts with a sub60 rating.- HOF Cpu is cheese itself: Wide-open jumpers fall 98% of the time. More shocked when it misses.- Some players just don't make sense: Bench players in real NBA and with low ratings in game plays like Kobe shooting over three guys.- AI defense is horrible: 80+ rating 3pt rating guard that can't finish on the outside? AI leaves him open. Pick and roll switch up? Non-existent. Basic man-to-man? How about Otto Porter Shaqtin a Fool every game. 30 RPG as a team and your player point guard has 8 of them? Why not.- Moving like you're on ice: Your player slides and glides like he's on ice and occassionally gets stuck when defending. Absolutely ridiculous.- AI passing: Have fun with turnovers because your AI teammates can't do jack.- MyCareer is a joke: Spike Lee is the worst part about this game. Oh wait... I said this already.- Certain players are just overpowered: Stephen Curry is a prime example.- Certain players just don't match with their stats and tendencies: Lebron is like the easiest thing to guard and Jeremy Lamb shoots over anybody and everybody. James Johnson shoots threes with a crap rating and low tendency which essentially means a turnover if he catches the ball near the three. - Refs are walking picks: I run into the ref on the fast break cuz they just on the court. I called for a pass and that thing ain't stopping until it gets to China.- Player does its own thing: Getting stuck in animations, not being able to do anything in certain situations (dive for ball and catching it, spin move and it starts pole dancing), and hyping up the crowd when opposing guard goes coast to coast for a dunk.- Get rid of the coach: He's annoying. How you gonna tell me score more inside when the only baskets we get are dunks. - WTF timeouts: They don't make sense *PERIOD* You get subbed in and a timeout comes immediately after they score. 10/10 trash programming.- Bounce passes: Slow, clunky, and receiver thinks its a booger and runs from it. No more fancy passes guys, stick with pick-n-roll and hope they don't do some superhuman sh** and intercept it outta nowhere.- Opposing HoF Defense is hax: Melo jumped over 8ft into the air to swat an alley-oop pass. Checked it in replay and Anthony Davis's head was under his feet. I broke up laughing at how sh** this game was when that happened. Wasn't even mad. Oh yeah and every player has whips as arms since they block passes out of their range.While a lot of these cons are persistent problems in the 2k games, it's just getting worse. Hyping up the MyCareer didn't help; it just added a sh** ton of backlashes.

, 2016
												Ok... I'm an Basketball/NBA fanatic.i have played NBA 2k series since 2k11 So i think i know what im talking about.-Rating-Graphics - 9/10Gameplay - 7/10Story - 1/10Soundtrack - Dont care about that. but 10/10 as allways-Pros- -Best Basketball game this year, well there is no competition, well i guess NBA live 16 lol.-As allways addicting-Online is so much fun.-MyTeam is great.-Nice looking game with great animations.-MyGm/MyLeague great game modes-Cons--Worst my career ever... You cant play in your rookie season...well... you can like 8 games. I liked the highschool and collage part but the story is just simple Sh** , you just want to skip it, dialogueis cringy as hell, well it was written by Spike Lee nothing more to expect... i like the off days option to do things you would like and i like the "Live practice" but one thing is missing from that... you cant improve your attributes by going to live practice like you could have in 2k11, you will just get a boost and xp thats it and you can earn a little vc like 50. Upgrading attributes- i hate it, those upgrade bars or what ever you call it , its stupid, bring the simple old one.-Gameplay- has so many flaws , pick and rolls are the worst , and each update they try to fix it before updates it was good enough you could live with that , 1st update broke every AI play would reach on pass and you couldnt get the pass trought on the 2nd one they made it great again, 3rd one i dont know, and now i think 4th its bad , seems like noone can set a screen , Noel, Cousins,Okafor or any other center cant do a screen they will catch contact with like 5th screen every  one who plays basketball knows if you set a screen you have to catch the player so the defender will switch, but dude sets the screen away from the player so the defender would go over the screen untouched, like what the hell and if the screen works the bigman would run away from the basket and wont get into position, so pick and roll is not effective at all.-Should be more options to get VC, by playing MyGm for example.-Passing should be fixed if a dude is wide open next to you and you point at him and pass the pass will go across the court to another dude that is defended by 2 defenders ... like why .....MyTeam wise the game improved alot and its soo fun to play, but this might be the worst MyCareer experience ever, it will make you more mad than happy... Didnt try MyPark yet, but when i upgrade my player i will.Overwall just for updates that simply doesnt add alot, for bad MyCareer, for stupid AI , for cringy story and for most of all this game costs 50 euros and at most this game should cost 25... so for all that i will give it a NO. BUT.... BUTT... ha butt .. But if it costs 16-22 euros buy it its worth that, play MyTeam mode and live happly :)Just Updateing for Event.

content:
2016
												My honest thoughts about NBA2K16 and the NBA2K franchise:NBA2K16's gameplay is great. The overall presentation is very smooth and the graphics have really stepped up its game since 2K15. I don't think the controls are as great as it was in 2K15, but I don't really have any complaint about it. No more ripped jersey shorts when players are dunking. No more of those alien-esque eye contacts when camera pans in on the players' faces. Also a lot less shot-clock cheese.MyCareer this year has given me the most emotional turmoil, ever. I really disliked the story, as you probably have heard everywhere how Spike Lee tried to add in his 2 cents to 2K, which resulted in the your player's family being African American regardless of what color skin your player has. I do enjoy the many accolades your player is able to achieve and how quickly you are able to level your character up to at least an all-star level. One of the things I hated about the previous NBA2K MyCareers is how little of VC earnings you get after every game, but 2K has fixed that issue in this year's release.MyTeam is a mode I enjoy very much. Every week 2K releases packs that you are able to buy and every week it has a different series of challenges that you are able to compete. 2K has really increased the amount of variety of player cards that you are able to receive. For example, for every NBA player there are multiple player cards such as the player's default card, dynamic ratings card, moments card, playoffs card, TBT player card, all star card, MVP card, and many more. Each card by the same player has different ratings depends on the type of cards, and it really adds in some flavor in collecting your cards and makes it exciting to open up packs because it always catch you off guard on what cards you may get. My personal favorite: a bronze Sim Bhullar rated at 69, but is an absolute beast in the post both offensive and defensively in the game.MyPark in my opinion is... ehhh. The gameplay is really great and all, but a lot of the times the park is either empty or is just a bunch of people who have formed cliques, or squads, to play against each other. If you are just trying to play a game by yourself, good luck finding a match because "you can't sit wid us".Now, onto the franchise. Ronnie Singh aka Ronnie2K, the NBA2K public relations and the main spokesperson, is probably the biggest joke in the gaming industry. The guy has very limited NBA knowledge and is terrible at trying to attract gamers to come back for more NBA2K. I remember sometime in April when @NBA2K on twitter reached 1 million followers, Ronnie2K promised every gamer will receive a gift as a thanks to such an achievement. So what did some gamers get? A simple T-shirt for MyCareer, a knee-pad upgrade, or bronze players for MyTeam. What did I get? A 71 Rating Kendrick Perkins. Yeah, what a joke. This really agitated the NBA2K gaming community and as such, the community started a #Unfollow2K movement which trended on twitter for a couple of days. The very next day after it reached 1M followers, the follower count was at 989K followers.I honestly don't know if I would recommend this game, or any of the NBA2K releases going forward. Unfortunately 2K is dominating in the sports games with no other competitors in near sight (Yeah I said it, EA), so I might consider buying some future releases... keyword 'MIGHT'.Thanks for reading this review. I hope you find this review helpful on making your decisions in purchasing this release or any of the new NBA2K releases.

content:
0, 2016
												Have you ever just wanted to pick up a sports game and make your own character and dominate the game? Well too ♥♥♥♥ing bad loser, you have to sit through an eternity of Spike Lee's explosive diaherria disaster of a story that drags on and on and on and garuntees you will never care about any other character except your own. Seriously, this story is so ♥♥♥♥ing slow and boring, and the characters are so annoying. I honestly don't care about the backstory of my player. I just want to play the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game. I did not spend money to watch my player get abused by an italian american sports agent. But the tremendously long cut scenes are not the only problem, however.In addition to cutscenes taking forever, it seems whenever there is a time out you are forced to watch your team walk to the bench, which takes around 5 seconds, but again, I don't give a ♥♥♥♥. in 2k14, as soon as i heard the timeout whistle i'd just skip it and start playing again. That's all I want to do. Play. I do not want to look at the atmosphere of the game or any of that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Just let me play.Lastly, however, when you are playing and finally get into the NBA, you can only play about 8 games or so your rookie year because of the stupid ♥♥♥♥ing cutscenes. So essentially, Spike Lee is cockblocking you from developing your character his rookie year. Also, your player ♥♥♥♥ing sucks. Can't make a jumpshot to save his life, can't get into the paint without forgetting how to dribble and losing the ball, and, if somehow you do get in the paint, you will be swarmed and the ball will be smited out of your hands. The absolute only thing you can be good at at this point in the game is free throws, and with your miniscule minutes, you will only get about 4 a game. When you finally get out of the trainwreck that is your rookie year, you can finally play a whole season without Spike Lee's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ brain child of a story groping your asscheeks. You enter free agency and can essentially join who ever you want. I joined the Knicks, so I don't know if this is true for whatever team you join, but your teammates are actually braindead. No one moves on their own. Everyone just stands there and moves in the direction you move. The AI are so bad in this game, I think I'd rather have Kwamwe Brown on my team than Robin Lopez.Also, what really annoys me are the Halftime report, and the post game show. I honestly think that the developers thought that we would actually want to watch them. My record for number of times I've pressed the A button to skip it must be around 3,000. Seriously, no one wants to watch that stupid crap. I JUST WANT TO PLAY THE GAME.Spike Lee cannot write and should not write ever again

content:
ber 29, 2015
												I (actual me) play as an average size/weight forward-center in Australia. I used NBA2K10 previously, and found that after playing it I was more conscious of my court position and defense in real games. Shocked! Playing from third person perspective made me focus on things that I hadn't really nailed on the real courts. I actually spent a whole season playing 2K10 for a couple hours before every game.Overall, I think a guy like me is in a pretty excellent position to judge the gameplay here, so I think I owe it to everyone to review it.I made myself in the game - Average size center. 7'0, 260. Though real me takes few jumpers I opted for all-around.So far, the good stuff;I love the post movement! It really echoes the way a lot of new players are being taught to post - not thinking about individual moves but thinking about position and response - You make a move and shoot if your defender wasn't able to respond, step through if he responded too hard, and make a second move if he responds smartly. It's very fluid, it's exactly how I think about my real post movement, and I like it. The second season (Takes a long time to get there...) is much, much better than the ruined first season. You have choice about your actions. You are coached... (it's rudimentary but at least it makes you think about changing your game up). You get to train (awesome!), doing some drills that might look familiar to organized ballers, and there is plenty of variation so you don't just do the same drill every time. So far, the bad stuff; The main reason I'm not recommending this: It's freezing. Sometimes it locks my computer completely, sometimes it merely quits the program mid-game. The first few hours this wasn't an issue. Today it seemed to be happening every game or two. I really don't have time to screw around with this kind of issue, and I'm sure a lot of you don't either.Skipping training is a smart thing to do in season 2? Plain stupid. Since you literally buy your skill, practice is now just a waste of valuable marketing time. I actually liked the training drills - especially as a guy who is new to playing virtual-basketball and using a game pad. In shootaround at training, you can't go back-to-basket and do a post move. What? I guess my guy is afraid of getting hit in the back of the head by a bricked shot. ♥♥♥♥♥. Let me post like in the home court screen. It matters to me, I'm a F/C. I don't want to shoot 3-pointers.     Slow players jump unreasonably high. Head crashing into the backboard but I can't change direction. In real players, vertical leap is pretty closely related to the general speed of the player on his feet. Very noticeable in 55OVR F/Cs.   Starter F/Cs react so slowly that there's no way they could ever play NBA. The slow CPU centers easily bust past 2 step sags.     Guards tend to misuse my screens - use me to shear off the defender! They are afraid of brushing my shoulder.To make up for this, 2k have put in some STUPID AI/animations where the screened opponent will go out of his way to trip over you. I've had a guy constantly changing direction just to trip over me while his man is 40 feet away making a layup. Insane stuff - it feels like cheating. I've counted guys running into me 4 or more times, long after their player has made his move. Sometimes they run into me even though their man is cutting away from me. They WANT to hit the screen.     I have my stats elevated by crazy bursts of speed when I go for blocks and rebounds from way out.     There's no context to the actions - player never seems to bail out of a rebound when he should.     Forwards aren't ready for rebounds. They seem to set feet after you tell them to rebound, not when the shot goes.     At least one 3-sec violation per game because he refuses to move after ignored call for pass. UNFORGIVABLE.The lack of depth perception (Not 2k's fault, but still a problem) means it's impossible to judge where a lot of shots will fall, limiting your ability to be ready for rebounds. CPU always gets the rebound on short airballs. Always. I'd say center is unplayable at 55ovr, but it gets a lot better once you up your stats a few points across everything. Pretty irritated about the amount of time it took for it to be playable though - I shouldn't need 10 hours of gameplay to be able to change direction and make a freethrow. Put me on an even footing. I don't want to dominate, I just want to be in the game. I am not able to believe I wouldn't get benched after 20 minutes shooting 20%, with a plus/minus of -15.As for the rest - you heard it in every other review. The first season is completely ruined. You aren't actually in any control until the 2nd season, so I guess it's NBA2k17. What were they thinking? The game runs as badly as my player does. Tutorials are garbage. A white guy will have a black twin... Everything bad anyone else says is probably true. Oh - and it's pretty hilarious to have my own shoe after half a season making 8ppg coming off the bench. 10/10 for comedy value. (And it's ♥♥♥-ugly. Didn't previous versions let you design them?)

Havent had a crash or D/C in months. Im still leaving this a thumbs down as the more you play, the more you realize how broken and annoying the defensive controls are in this game. stay away unless youre a hardcore NBA fan, or you see this game on sale by some miracle.update 6/19 - still crashing again now. ♥♥♥♥ you 2k.

number of helpful: 69 of 92 people (75%) found this review helpful10 people found this review funny
content:
ber 28, 2015
												MY CAREER ONLY REVIEW ONLYPros:--EDIT: Had to change this section as more crap was changed.  Less pros and more cons I am afraid.--The game is 60% SOLID GOLD when it is not fudging things.  It rewards you for hustle and punishing you for playing stupid D.  That is how it should be every game.  Unfortuately there is the other 40% and makes you want to throw your remote through the monitor.  There is nothing worse than playing a game and feeling like you have no outcome on the results.  Hmm...come to think of it...sounds just like Spike Lee's garbage.  OOPS!  Sorry...that was a rip in the PROS section.  Sorry!--The second season is how the game should be.  You have a lot of options to make money/points.  CONS:--I don't think I have to elaborate much on the utter BS that is Spike Lee.  He makes the first part of the game so painful that I am DREADING having to do it again.  I know you can skip things but you should not have to live through one second of it.  As other says....it's brutal.  What's funny is that if a white person had done this 'first year' he would have been called a racist.  Since it's Spike its ok evidently.  Add to it that you have ZERO control on ANYTHING that happens.....just f-ing brutal.   A cut scene where the parents talk about how they met?  Are you MENTAL?  OMG!!!! Who the SH-T gives a flying f-ck how his parents met?  Seriously?  If I wanted to read that I would steal my wife's romance novels.  STOP THE MADNESS!---The game is 'fixed' to an extent, worse so on the higher difficulties.  If you shoot 65% from the field the Ai will simply 'adjust' the game so that the other team will get multiple offensive rebounds (even if they are the worst rebounding team in the league), have 10+ points more from the free throw line (in one quarter) and of course the old faithful game 'balancer" the 3 point shot.  Listen, this happens every F-ing game!!!!!  Its not a 'every once in a while' thing...the computer WILL make you miss/turn the ball over/<insert thing you did not do>.--As you play you will be "throttled".  In this I mean that in 'real life' the chances of you going 10 for 10 from the field is pretty slim.  Well, this is just a game of code so you WILL be forced to miss shots.  I am ok with missing shots...its just missing the WIDE OPEN LAYUP or DUNK....TWICE IN A ROW....that I can not tolerate.  If you are not throttled there it will happen at the beginning of the game (especially in game 2 or 3 of a playoff series).  You will 'magically' start only making 1 or 2 out of 7 shots.  That happens right? The problem is your shots are of the wide open layup/dunk variety.  I just roll my eyes becuase I KNOW that I will 'struggle with my shot'...and then magically make the next 12!  This exact situation has happened MANY times to the point that I can predict it after 3 shots in the game.  --I duped a guy in the post.  I went up for a layup (not sure why a 7'3" guy would do a layup when he can DUNK while standing on the floor) and just...missed it.  Can't this happen?  SURE it has happened.  The problem is that it happens EVERY F-ING GAME!  This is 10 fold the story when you play the highest difficulty.  I passed to a streaking Jimmy Butler who was a few feet ahead of his guy...aka a BREAKAWAY.  He could have dunked it with his mouth if he wanted...but he does a layup and almost missed the whole rim.  Why?  We were past the magical number the computer said we could be ahead because it must REMAIN CLOSE!-- By this time last year I had almost 250 hours in game.  This year...pft!  I pick it up once a week, play a quarter, get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off and then rage off.  Double teaming is worthless for applying pressure.  Its only helps with contested shots.  Pressure, the guy just passes out of it with ZERO problems.  Then I stand in front of the guy I am guarding with my hands up.  He just throws a ball that flies right over my head to the guy under the basket.  The Ai can pass like that all day and there is NOTHING you can do about it.  Steals only happen if you jump the lane...but if you are standing IN THE F-ING LANE the ball goes just in front of your face..and the second guy...and the third...to the one under the basket who will F-ING NEVER miss the shot.  --They adjusted the passing so that if you are in an excellent spot to intercept a pass...and you are not allowed to steal it because the other team is on a run or if you have too many....the pass will move at 3x its normal speed so you are late.  Happens EVERY GAME.  This goes 10x for trying to intercept the ball on the inbounds.  It just simply goes faster so you can't intercept. --They adjusted the game so that if the ball touches ANY PART OF THE OTHER TEAM'S players it you will lose the ball.  Now, this seems to make sense right?  Yes and no.  Yes it makes since but no it does not because IT DOES NOT COUNT AGAINST THE Ai OPPONENT!  You dribble on a guy's foot..turnover (remember, you won't get 90% of loose balls).  The Ai will dribble the ball where it goes THROUGH your HEAD and CHEST as your arm goes through it as you try to steal it.  The ball will then go through the two defenders next to you and they will score.  This actually happens MULTIPLE times EVERY game.  Even had one game Kyrie dribbled through my legs and lost the ball...or so I thought.  It went 10 feet away, changed direction in mid air and then shot back into his hand so he could power dunk on me.  --Went on a run.  Did a pick and roll in which both guys tried to trap me.  Great right?  I bounce passed to the open guy 3 feet in front of the basket.  He catches it and...layup?  No! Dunk? NO!  He gets ready to jump but then just pauses until the defender 10 feet away makes it over.  Then he tries a REVERSE LAYUP...that goes INTO the defender.  This shot got...BLOCKED!  I know!  Shocking!I don't know why I bother playing this game.  I guess its for the 60% solid gold part.  Its the 40% FOOL'S GOLD part that make me quit.  I am quite sad as I know next year will be using 90% of the same code as this year.  It will end up the same and I just can't do this again.  They have lost me as a fan.  :-(

ber 25, 2015
												I do recommend this game for any basketball fan out there, but NBA 2K16 has its pros and cons. I'll break it down. Pros:-Smoother Animations-Dunk Animations are a lot better-Improved MyCareer-Defense movement has been improved-Rebounding has also improved (Thank God)-Stunning Graphics-Shoe Deals are now gone so now you don't need to wait like 30 games+ for a shoe deal (Thank you lord)Cons:-Frame Rate Issues (Usual with early release games due to NVIDIA Drivers or 2K Sports optimizations not done correctly)-Where are the bonus's from the Pre-Orders?-Animations seem to stutter once in a while-Without the shoe deal, it requires you to purchase them with in game VC (Although this is a lot better than waiting 30 games+ for a shoe deal)-Default graphics processor is Intel's Integrated GPU (WTF?)With all that said,NBA 2K16 isn't a bad game and it's definiately a better basketball simulator than NBA Live series that EA is trying to bring back. It just requires new NVIDIA Drivers or 2K Sports to optimize the game. Gameplay and all is fine. Just the lag is just killing me.

												Really good game. Make sure you have a controller however.To expand on my review a little bit, 2K has made strides to keep the community happy, while this hasn't always worked, the game keeps its consistency. With other modes then just "PLAY BEEEBAALL" like MyGM where you manage a team and can go as far as set ticket prices and keep players happy, to MyTeam which is a mode similar to Madden Ultimate Team where you gather cards to make a team to do challenges to get more cards and virtual currency to spend.I do have one con however, if you're looking for a constant online group to play with, this might not be it. In my own experience I can never get matched with people online, and when I do my connection gets dropped instantly, this includes all online modes such as The Park which is like a free for all basketball mode, allowing you to hop in a street game on command. I'm sure its different if you have friends that are willing to play, however I do not so I have to matchmake.My verdict is 8.9/10Also if you're interested, there is mod support that 2K likes to keep under wraps, check out the NLSC forum for HD mods for players, stadiums, and all other sorts of enhancements.

content:
r 27, 2015
												Pros:- Improved responsivness on defense- Removed some of the cheese from 2k15 (charge cheese and zigzag 27 foot threes)- Improved post play- Off days in MyCareer (ability to get MyTeam cards from MyCareer)- More realistic reboundingCons:- Minor improvement over 2k15 (They were saying that they removed the cheese in 2k16, but they actually created it in 2k15 with Patch #4. 2k15 just needed some sliders tweaking)- Hyped up MyCareer story didnt deliver- Short highschool season (3 games with 2 minute quarters)- Short college season (4 games with 6 minutes halftimes)- Only 8 games in rookie season- Not being able to play on custom designed arena in ProAM- Proam doesnt work most of the time ("Friend has changed park...")- Blocking is way to easy, even with 6ft pointguard- Stealing is too easy, especially stripping players on fastbreak or under the rim- Big men (PF/C) have no ball protection in the post- Midrange shots go in 90+ % of the time, even with terrible players- Baseline midrange jumpers go in 100% of the time, even heavily contested- Post fadeaway still cheese- Hackers, hackers, hackers (even though they had one attempt of banning them)- People banned because of the developers lazyness (account rollback/reset would make more sense than BAN)- Real hackers still running around hidden as fake 55 overalls- Hackers in MyTeam/Gauntlet that make your game freeze and give you 80-0 loss- "A problem has been encountered that prevents gameplay from continuing. This game will not be counted." --> Caused when you press pause in 1st quarter and sometimes caused by CE users. Still rewards a loss even though it says that game will not be counted- Ball tangibility still not good (ball going through players, floating in players hands, ball teleporting dribble)- Poor AI for both your teammates in mycareer and cpu opponents (cpu still more effective because of HoF cheese)- VC harder to earn than in 2k15- Over agressive CPU defense (not that I like last year Nba Jam, but this is way too much)- PnR way too effective- Brick wall knocks down players on every 2 screens- Awkward automatic fadeaway on contested shots that arent that much contested- Barely any graphical improvement over the last year- Performance issues (havent encountered them personally, but many people with high end GPUs have them)- Invisible players in every game mode, even Park/ProAm- Same terrible upgrade system from 2k15 that they tried to "balance" adding stat caps. Grouping attributes in categories prevents players from specializing in certain areas and therefore all the players are the same. (cant make a player that is good at freethrows but sucks at 3 pointers etc..)- Inability to configure keyboard controls- Controller settings often reset (boxout assist strength and defensive assist strength)- Took them 10 days to give us our preorder bonuses- Players missing from MyTeam collectionsTo sum up: Definitely not worth the full price. Get it in a month or two after few patches and on some discount.

content:
er 16, 2015
												This game is mediocre at best. Rebounding works good, thats the only praise I will give this game. Story sucks, character creation sucks, customization sucks, pay too win sucks, gameplay sucks and can be incredibly frustrating to the point of wanting to punch a hole through your monitor or smash your game pad into a thousand little pieces.  Honestly, this game just sucks. Below is what is broken.-CPU STEALS (Good luck dribbling in a straight line, the cheese cpu steals are real with this one, guess how many times cpu gets called for reaching in? NEVER)- ISO MOVES ( Also ties into the cpu cheese steals, I call it the turnover stick now. Even with the absolute setting and a decent playmaking skill half the time you will do a random move and often multiple random moves which results in, you guessed it, turnovers)- SHOT METER ( So you know for a fact you got a perfect release? Well 2k doesnt think so. So many times I've stoped the slider on the left of the bar only for it to magically appear on the right)- USER STEALS ( So youre hand goes straight through the ball and you think you've got yourself a steal? Think again, the cpu steal cheese does not carry over to your abilities, you're more likely to get called for a reach in. Many times the cpu will run right through you and it wont even phase him, you try to do the same? TURNOVER)- CPU DEFENSE ( So you just pulled off a sick spin move without turning the ball over and you're now 6ft away from your opponent with an open lane to the rim? Well too bad! The cpu wizardry will warp the player at light speed and stop you in your tracks mid dribble)- USER DEFENSE ( Good luck playing any sort of relevant defense as a guard if you dont have near max athleticism, you could play defense just as good as the computer but the cpu will most of the time either glitch right through you or run right around you with ease, and good luck getting back on defense if you take one wrong step because youll be stuck there for about 3 seconds)-CPU SHOT SELECTION ( So you just tossed Joakim Noah the ball right on the baseline with an easy driving lane to the hoop and you're wondering what kind of mystical dunk he is getting ready to perform? FORGET ABOUT IT, he's going to stay planted and shoot a fadeaway 12 footer and miss badly, costing you an assist and some points on the board.- TURBO BUTTON ( So you're mashing the turbo button because you see something in the defense you can exploit? Well too bad for you because it will take at least 2 seconds, if at all, before your character decides to start sprinting into a cpu player who wasn't there 2 seconds ago which results in more turnovers. I know I'm forgetting many more flaws.PLEASE, WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. DO NOT SUPPORT THE DEVELOPER WHEN THEY CONTINUE TO RELEASE BAD GAME MECHANICS YEAR AFTER YEAR AND DO NOT RELEASE ANY SORT OF RELEVANT PATCHES. STICK WITH 2K15 OR 2K14 FOR THAT MATTER, AS EVEN THOSE GAMES ARE SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN THIS TRASH. DO NOT BE A SUCKER AND WASTE 60$ ON THIS GAME, YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED. DONT EXPECT TO PLAY ONLINE UNLESS ALL OF YOUR FRIENDS PLAY BECAUSE THIS GAME IS DEAD, MY PARK IS EMPTY. ONLY GET THIS GAME IF YOU WANT TO AVERAGE 8 TURNOVERS A GAME WITH YOUR MY PLAYER POINT GUARD.IF YOU TAKE ANYTHING FROM THIS REVIEW IT SHOULD BE DONT BUY THIS GAME!!!

content:
r 23, 2015
												A review from the most despised guy on the 2k16 forum right now coming live and free of charge (no VC here) right to you:It's hard to actually find somewhere to start guys and gals because there is just so much wrong with this game. Maybe let's do it bit by bit:General:- good ol' VC is returning and damn it's good to have it back. I so missed flushing 50 bucks down the toilet for a game and then being charged for any and every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t item. The prices have gone up and are now really insane while how much you earn, even on HoF has actually gone down.- lack of technical support makes a return as well. Yeah like always the PC community is again the but of the joke because again we are desperately waiting for technical issues to be solved and are waiting and waiting and waiting. 4 weeks after the pre-release the PS4 patch is out for 2 weeks now and we still haven't seen ♥♥♥♥ or even been given a possible release date.- lack of support also makes a comeback. Yeah for a game that costs you 50 bucks or more you will actually have to wait  up to seven days to even get a random answer which does not relate to your problem at all and which, even when you press them, offers no help whatsoever because they either don't know or they aren't allowed to do anything.- commentary of the game cuts out like every quarter. It's unbearable.- there is a bug that displays players naked or makes the invisible. They are invisible yet they pass, dribble, shoot and score on your ♥♥♥ all day long.- 2k TV regulary crashes the game.- the audience is barely audible. During freethrows and timeouts it's basically like you are playing a pickup team on a farm in Iowa... no sound at all.- you have around 10-20 seconds before the actual timeout screen sets in allowing you to change settings and setups and you can not ever skip those 10-20 seconds. So have fun with that one especially when the stupid A.I. calls 2 timesouts back to back.- basically anything above Allstar Sim is getting close to unplayable because of all the incredible cheese the A.I. pulls off- defensive A.I. of opponent improved while the defensive A.I. of your team is absolute garbage in every situation- still too many animations in which your player gets sucked intoMyCareer:- hyped to no end because it's a Spike Lee Joint and because people were complaining about the player basically being chosen for you (background story and all) they produced a hillarious video in which they claim that you can "be yourself" and make your own story. I call ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t on that one. You play a guy called Frequency Vibrations, I ♥♥♥♥ you not, nickname Freq. This is the name you will be referred to in game even though you have the option to name your player and the announcers will, at random times, call you by it. That no one thought to tell Spike Lee to ♥♥♥♥ off and that not even the actors themselves thought it is beyond stupid that anyone would call anybody Frequency Vibrations is just... well I can't find words for it. You are also forced to be African American because your family is black as is your twin sister and obviously everyone around you apart from some overhyped agent who speaks and acts like it's 1930's Chicago south side and an Asian girlfriend who seems only interested in your money. Yeah... you heard me.- you do not make any decisions in your career until you reach your second year in the NBA. Every cutscene is an overlong piece of film that you are forced to watch (some lasting 10 minutes easy) or skip. You choose no answers, you make no decisions and that stuff is so corny like someone actually tried to make a bad comedy out of "He got game"- you get to play 3 games in Highschool which last all of 2 minutes per quarter in which you play against dwarfes ( I believe the tallest player might be Tracy McGrady's height and that guy plays center) while you stroll around in your up to 7'3 glory. What a joy. You can do everything, run fast as the wind, shoot threes and what not even though you are only rated 55. Once you get to college the real NBA stuff applies and unless you are buying VC (because guess what you don't earn any in Highschool and College) you are a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 55 rated player even though you are hailed as the next Madonna or some such.- your first NBA season is 8 games... with a 55 rated player unless you buy VC... yeah what fun. At the end you get to actually go into free agency even though you are a first round rookie so should have at least a 2 year contract plus 1-2 years team option. Oh yeah and some ♥♥♥♥♥♥ end to the story happens.MyGM:- legacy issues like having to manually adjust every gameplan instead of the newest global gameplan being taken into account without having to delete the old specific gameplan for a team. broken player promises: even if you kiss the guys ♥♥♥ and do everything he asks you to, he will still return a day later and tell you that you screwed him over and lied to himn and doesn't like you anymore. Guys who put up 0,5 ppg in 1 minute of gametime will come to you asking for a starting spot etc.- no list for team names in relocation so you might end up with a team that has no name the announcers can pronounce- players still develope too fastOnline:- full of cheaters and yes I'm saying that even though I moderate a thread for the CE tables to this game. Funny enough the same ♥♥♥♥ as last year is still working and even more horrendous VC farming is possible. Now 2k swung the banhammer and guess what? Even though lots of people claim that they removed the cheaters, they actually only removed the guys who used VC glitches because of course it costs them actual money ;)Positive:- defensive A.I. seems improved- post game seems improvedEnd of story:As it is it's a pile of garbage. You want to know why? Check above... it's because the devs and producers were busier explaining ♥♥♥♥ that makes up 0,1% of the whole game in dope ♥♥♥ videos than actually improving last years installments. Buy 2k15 or even better... don't support 2k ever again.

content:
ber 28, 2015
												Overall the gameplay is much improved from NBA 2k15(which i put almost 600 hours into) between MYGM, and MyCareer modes. There are more animations and they feel smoother and more realistic. Dribbling and using the right stick to crossover and perform other moves is still very satisfying. The shot meter is back and feels the same helping you to guide shots into the net. Defense even has its own meter that shows how close to the defender you are and how much pressure you are producing on him.  There have been some small control changes since 2k15. Now the face buttons of the controller allow you to perform bounce passes, or lob passes alongside the standard pass. This helps you feel more in control and turn the ball over less. Centers and other big men down low feel more like you are playing their counter parts. Slow, not very good ball handling but big tall bruisers who use their size to their advantage. Defense has been slightly improved and shots are harder to make, as you are less likely to be wide open. This more realistically portrays FG % in the NBA and feels less cheesy online. Graphics are improved as well, with 2k adding in new body scans. Carmelo Anthony now looks substantially different than Lebron James. As mentioned before animations feel smoother and more realistic. I have experienced some crashing issues when in game and navigating menues. There are also some random glitches in game that detract from the overall experience. For example there is a new feature when your my player is subbed into the game.This feature shows the player you are currently guarding or being guarded by. It shows the players strengths and weaknesses. There is a problem that occurs randomly however when the players strengths/ weaknesses never appear and you are stuck looking at a semi frozen image of the player for 30 seconds. After playing last years version im sure the bugs will still be there months later(none are gamebreaking save for the infrequent crashes, just minor annoyances.)There is no ability to configure keyboard controls. 2k literally gave no thought to the PC gamer with this port. Crossfire is terrible but with my one AMD r9 270x i am getting 60 FPS with very little stuttering, so i am pleased with the optimization especially over last years version.There is a wide plethora of game modes in this years game, i have never dabbled in My team because i hate pay to win. But MYGM is fun and feels improved. The real reason i cannot recommend this game at full price is the changes to MYCareer and to be specific the changes directed by Spike Lee. Livin' Da Dream is a joke.You create a character like in past iterations of the gamemode however this time you dont get to choose a nickname because that persona has already been created for you. Spike Lee has dubbed your character Frequency Vibrations or Freq for short, sex toy or porn star either way the name is terrible. The story revolves around your character and his family, you are born into a african-american family with an african-american twin sister. If the story following all this was actually good and well written than maybe i could excuse my white character who looked totally out of place and confused as to why his mom had never told him who his real father was. Honestly its not a big deal, things like this have happened to other races and games in the past and i could get over it, the problem is the story is absolutely terrible. The story revolves around your friend VIctor Van Lier who is supossed to be a bad influence on you and you are warned multiple times by the team owner, your twin sister, and your characters girlfriend who comes out of nowhere sometime in college.   You dont get to make any choices about how your story unfolds besides the choice of High schools (1 of 3) and choice of colleges (1 of 9). The story is so melodramatic, people arguing over your image or multiple refrences to friends and family using you as a meal ticket. Choices of team do not affect the story any. Minor details like your characters celebratory dance "freaking and vibin" as well as interviews of family and friends during the cutscenes do nothing to add anything to the terribly written farse that is Livin' Da Dream.  Spike Lee seems to believe that people from Harlem have the same terrible vernacular that he embodys in his titles. This terrible story mode takes away your rookie season as well, which is something that 2k really seems to enjoy in MYCareer the last two years. You get to play 3 Highschool games where your character is truly OP and 4 college games but not earn any VC for them as well as not be able to change the game lengths. Your character than is forced to be a one and done player and go to the NBA draft with an overall rating of 55, which is terrible. You are heralded as a top 10 draft pick, i went number 7 but the other players selected around that time are 77-78. By design 2k makes you either a terrible player or have to open your wallet just to keep up. Your rookie season is only 8 games (instead of the 82 in a real NBA season) with Spike Lee's terrible 20 minute cutscenes in between. Also you can change the Freq nickname after your rookie season but for some reason announcers/ pre game show will still sometimes refer to you as Freq. After your rookie season MyCareer returns to its roots allowing you to play any games along the season you would like while also introducing a new days off feature and allowing you to select whether or not to go to a "Live practice" or hang out with teamates/fellow Nba players or go do endorsement deals. This is where MyCareer should have started. "Live Practices are fun and really the draw in this mode is building a character and watching his career progress rather than slated cutscenes of melodrama.  Somewhere along the way this mode lost all its basing in realisim as well because after your first season the team owner realeases you to go into Free Agency where you can choose three teams that have varying levels of interest in your sevices and negotiate Money and minutes. I think Spike Lee tries to rationalize it with your friend Victor causing you to get fired. Honestly though has anyone ever heard of a top 10 pick being dropped because of a friends actions? Spike Lee just took the easy way out as he did with most of the other parts of this mode. Tldr: Really i cant recommend the game even though gameplay is so much better and graphics improved because of how much the Mycarrer mode has declined. I still find ways to enjoy the game, but get it on deal since this is turning into a yearly cash cow akin to EA's.

number of helpful: 27 of 33 people (82%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
, 2016
												NBA 2k16 has incredible graphics, gameplay is generally very smooth, and server performance is vastly improved from recent years.  However, there are an insane amount of small issues that add up and these have all been here since release, that makes gameplay very frustrating.  Many features are incomplete, or just dont work.  Directional passing for example, there is no way to pass to a player behind another player without manually selecting that player and allowing the defense time to react.  every second counts in basketball.  VIP Stats (their online stats program) shows in depth tendencies and stats about the opponent you play at the loading screen, but there is no way to see any stats besides PPG and Win/Loss for your own profile, when they obviously have the information available to them. Whenever a stoppage of play occurs there is a period of time where you are stuck just watching a cutscene, no matter how badly you want to skip, you cannot.  This happens at literally every single stoppage of play, and for me is the most infuriating part of the game when I am trying to play a fast paced game.Play Now Online allows players to choose their own jersey before they match up with another player, so if a player chooses a white home jersey before they match up with me, gets the Away team, and then doesnt change their jersey I will have no idea that he is using a white jersey instead of what should be a colored jersey since he is the Away team.  This means both teams in game have nearly identical jerseys and the game is so frustrating to play when you have to really stare to see who is on which team in transition.MyGM and MyLeague have a multitude of options, but lack very basic NBA rules such as the veterans minimum, and protected picks, the latter completely destroying any hopes of a MyGM or MyLeague with the Lakers without cheating and force trading their top 3 pick.   You can sign Steve Nash for 725k or so but in real life he cannot be paid less than $1.49m if he were to sign a contractAt times gameplay AI seems random, for example there seems to be a 50% chance that on a transisition you pass the ball to your teammate he will either stand still and catch it or keep running and theres no way to know what will happen.  On offense the AI actually sometimes feels like it is rigged against you, with your players playing either unrealisticly or flat out refusing to obey controller commands.   Example:  shooters that have a wide open 3 go inside the line and when I try to get them to go behind the line (and this has happened many times for me), they literally just wont go behind the line I dont get it. Defensive AI feels the same way.  Double team is set to manual but they still decide to leave their 3pt shooter wide open to double team someone who doesnt need to be double teamed, and wasnt told to double team2K puts no effort in updating hairstyles of players, with the majority of players having the same hair they had in summer 2015 when they got scanned, and there have been lots of changes during the season.  Allen Crabbe is one example thats not even close to real life anymoreMyCareer is terrible the first season is garbage the High School and College experience comes off as annoying and tedious since none of it matters at all there is no story that changes its the same thing every time, so after youve made your first player its just annoying to go thru it all over again to get to NBA.Cannot stress how bad MyCareer is we were told that we were going to Be The Story, and that couldnt be farther from the truth.  Its Freq's Career by Spike Lee for the entire first season, you only get to play 8 rookie games!!Every single game of Online play you will have to change your settings, they just do not save and there is no way to get them to default to something else.  This functionality does not work and has not worked for years.  It even changes the camera angle so if you dont get the first possession you have to play in Broadcast mode until you get the ball. In MyGM, MyLeague, and MyCareer, your gameplay settings (length, difficulty, sliders) all have to be set every single time you make a new franchise/career no matter what the default settings are.  The default settings seem to only make a difference in Play Now offline. Getting locked in animations.  Just ridiculous there are so many long animations in this game ESPECIALLY after scoring a bucket and celebrating your opponent can run the ball up court while you watch your player dancing and celebrating in the backcourt.   Just terrible.  Awful.   My controller actions are not suggestions they are commandsIf your controller gets disconnected during online play, you cannot reconnect it under any circumstances and have to restart 2k in order to be able to play it further.  This will always result in a loss unless its late in the game and you have a comfortable lead and waste the clock playing with your keyboard.  But idk even 1 control for thatMyCareer doesnt allow Draft classes.  cant think of any reason to not include this.  It also doesnt allow GM sliders so the trades and Free agency are unrealistic in MyCareer modeOverall this is a very good basketball game, but the tiny problems make it infuritating to playAs we unfortunately have to ask every single year in the 2k community, PLEASE FIX YOUR GAME

er 15, 2015
												Best basketball sim on the market... but mainly because NBA Live sucks that much. NBA 2k16 gets revised controls, slightly better graphics, and a new story mode. If you've played an NBA 2k game in the past you know what you're getting into. Sadly, this includes a lot of the AI frustrations you come to expect. Instead of playing intelligent AI the way 2k  ramp up difficulty is making you miss dunks, layups and making the computer intercept passes like crazy. Tough to recommend due to the poor AI, but then again what choice do you have as a basketball gamer? Also, who wants to see all those useless inbounding and timeout animations? Everyone is just tapping A like crazy to try and skip it... Also where is the ability to save different GM files? The new story mode has such a long and boring beginning it's hard to get into as well. Maybe I'm just being old and grumpy, but the 2K series is getting too cinematic for its own good. How about 2K focus on making the core basketball gameplay better and get rid of the fluff.
