er 12, 2015
												so I play the 2k series since nba2k8.I say this first before i'll write my review, i keep playing this game most likely.So i start with the Pro's first-Great Graphics, awesome faces etc-mycareer,myleague,mygm and myteam are nice and well done-it runs very smoothly on my rigso cons, well where do i start ?Lets just start with animations, while animations on its own are sick and look awesome, Ingame they are a pain in the ♥♥♥!You'll get stuck in movements you don't press. while my PG is a 89Rating, he seems to forget sometimes how to dribble(which is weird with playmaking above average). Passing is pretty easy, but sometimes the players are getting into a movement right before you pass, those passes fly anywhere but not to a teammate( it seems to me this happens because the game has overall big problems with input lag). Input lag is annoying af, i tested it now on several configurations and two different rigs, as well 4 different controllers. Its always there and always affecting things on court.If you're an attacking pg, this game hates you then, while you drive to the basket and have a path like moses, everybody on the opponent team will catch you( not matter how fast you are)i witnessed it a lot that a sf or sg just kinda teleported to me and blocked me, while i was getting stucked in some weird layup animation i did not choose(i have the steph curry layup pack, which rarely applies). Big no go is also defense. Enemy Teams always defend like pros (which is actually nice and challanging)BUT your Team defend like a new born child, this is especially in mycareer annoying. Im sure that withour those animation stucks and rigged scores this game would make actually a lot of fun, ofc the input lag should be fixed(this seems like its pc only, as i watched many youtubers and streamers and they never really had it)one thing to the mycareer, while i like the idea its poorly made! hey they got spike lee and some actors WoW! the story is boringand never really interesting, also never really a surpise whats happening( besides the talk that im a superstar when i only play 12 min per game(12min qtr). its way to short as well.so this game seems to be only for addicted nba dudes like me, new guys wont like it. the controlls are way do difficult. and no help for new guys when they start a career or do something else, they have to search for help(yeah i know tutorials are boring but for new players in this type of a game, needed badly)my final conclusion is:if you love the nba and the nba2k series you most probably already have it, if not you may pass on, on this one.its way better then nba live(which tbh is not very hard)but since they got "next gen" it did get more and more a type of game that looks and plays awesome for the first 2 weeks, but if u know more of it and understand everything it starts to fall apart. i have also a lot more i could go on about but those things are in the series forever so i do not believe they fix it ever.ps i forgot about mypark:mypark is kinda fun but on pc their're a lot of cheated players (99ovr) which are mostly pretty bad but a lot of 2v2 groups are out there cheating their ways to the top. Also a lot of ballhogs and wannabe kobes,lebrons,kds,mjs.

content:
r 1, 2015
												This is my review of NBA 2k16(aka Skinner Box Simulator 2k16). I think NBA 2k is consistently the only worthwhile basketball title every year.  I love it mostly. But I was unable to even connect to this offerings server. It also follows a sad precedent that appears to be taking hold in the video game industry, especially in the regurgitated yearly sports titles. I named myself B F Skinner and wanted to get online in 2k almost as a ironic statement of protest, but wasn't able to. Back in the days, a guy named BF Skinner put hamsters in a box and studied their reward response through a small lever and a treat that was dropped upon pressing it. He figured out that when they press it and instantly receive said reward, they will eat the treat and lie down. But when the reward was randomly dropped they would continuously press the button to exhaustion. This is the basic underlying element of MyTeam. If you don't believe it, watch any of the pack openings on internet video sites. What you are witnessing is the highs and lows which stimulates the brains chemical response mechanisms. When the user taps the button(buying packs) he will repeatedly get cards he doesn't like leading to depression/frustration. When a gold/whatever other stupid color special card drops, they jump all over the place with glee, brains flooding with endorphines. This is troubling if one understands the mechanisms which are involved, considering real money is being spent. Seems to closely resemble the same involvement of drug abusers and their crack of choice. If doubles where eliminated, or if VC was more readily attainable, I guess it would seem more acceptable. It also seems to be marketed directly to minorities, which is another thing that may or may not be okay to you. I have also seen that when one shows a willingness to spend money, your myteam players seem to perform worse then they should. I can recall in 2k15, getting Steph Curry(Mr three ball cheese) and lighting it up with glee. All of a sudden he's hitting 2-30. Same with KD. etc etc. "Gotta get more packs,,,, Next one is Mike,,, 50 dollars,,, just one more,, awww kostas kodsafjiosdfjioasdg? Emerald Dirty Ballscamp??? Double, double, double,  C'mon!" <-- sound familiar? You've been gamed, boys and gals. Next time you needs a sammich, think of all the gold cards you can't sell. This may or may not be okay to write, as I'm sure this is not the info that peeps want you to hear. Could possibly get the business for sharing it. But they don't teach B F Skinner usually. I'm sure some may know, but it feels wrong when others are fleeced for their dollar and coin. Buy a game with some integrity, which actually has value, made by people interested in putting out a quality product. People who value your business, and respect your intelligence. Less taking selfies with millionaire b-ballers, less cute spokesmodels, less "oh snap, a penny!" <lunges to the floor to grab>. More community support, more involvement in production, more beta testing, more originality. An added bonus would be to consider the fact that the people you are taking money from are human, and may or may not be able to afford your digital heroin. Just my two cents. Honestly, I loved this game for years. Just feels so wrong on so many levels. My recommendation, skip it until they decide to make changes. This is the only way change happens. You keep forking over your dollars, it will keep getting worse.

content:
16, 2016
												There are mixed reviews for this game, but now that it's on sale (as of Mar 16), I feel obligated to leave a review for those who may be thinking of buying. Ultimately, if you love the game of basketball, you should get this game right now. Notes on MyCAREER:- There are a &#$^ ton of people giving it negative reviews solely because of the subpar MyCAREER story, but if you can look past that it's still a solid basketball game. - highschool + college years are really fun albeit short- your MyCAREER players all share the SAME appearance that you define in the myPlayer menu, so you can change it at will if you wish (differs in height depending on your position)- You can keep playing with your MyCAREER player after you finish the main story, and even use your player for MyPARKNotes on MyPARK: - If you're planning on playing this mode, I have found from personal experience that the Sunset Ballers is the most populated with more active players.- You do NOT need to spend money on VC to be able to play well - Sometimes you'll come across players who won't play with you or drop out when you enter a court queue because you have a low rating -- don't let this discourage you just keep looking and you'll find some nice players who will play :)- Not sure if this is the case for everyone, but there is a tiny button delay; just be aware of it --  Also if you find that your controller disconnects when you enter a game, try restarting your game in Steam Big Picture modeMyGM: - Many sliders and options to pla around with to manipulate your team's playstyle- Enough control- Stat-heavy if you're into that9.5/10

r 26, 2015
												Mycareer mode story is not even close to as imersive or nice as 2k15. You can select a nickname after your first season, but you will still be called Freq. The story has no choices until second season of pro, at which the game is the same choices as 2k15. The main character is likeable, but most of the side characters are not. Your best friend is an unlikeable jerk, your manager a stereotype, the owner is the devil, your twin sister and parents may or may not match your skin color(honestly those characters are cool), and the girlfriend is kinda just there. The Mycareer mode now has game days and offdays, which is a nice change added to break up games. The new way to get upgrades by consistently going to practice on off days is also nice. You can also see upcoming endorcement offer to plan accordingly. All in all improvement from 2k15. This is also the only not online gamemode I have played.The online is full of blantent hackers who get away with murder. If you want to fight them legit, be prepared to farm all the badges and atribute points you can. They seem to not be doing anything to stem the flow of hackers. I had personal issue with their customer support taking forever to reply and giving me the run around, until eventually saying they can't do anything. At least the courts are nice to look at. Between the Rough Riders, Flyers, and Ballers, only the ballers court seems to stay full.Gets 6/10 for Bad online and mediocre story, but extra points for trying to improve. Do not buy on PC if you plan on playing legitly online. If you plan on playing by hacking, please unplug you computer and walk away.

content:
2, 2016
												This game is utter ♥♥♥♥. Seriously, it is one of the most frustrating experiences I have ever had the displeasure to have. The controls are completely unresponsive, as in you just can't dribble the ball to the direction you want to go. Almost every time you try to change direction or a crossover move, not only does it take more than 1 second for your player to respond, you're either gonna bounce the ball off of the defender or he's just gonna stop you and you'll be stuck in a stupid animation where even if you're pressing to go forward the controlled player is just going to stop. 9 times out of 10 you're unable to get by the defender. I've had situations where I had Russell Westbrook with the ball and I couldn't drive by Jose Calderon. Yes, Russell Westbrook can't get by Jose ♥♥♥♥ing Calderon in this game. Now, I've been playing basketball simulation games since NBA Live 07 and NBA 2K8. I'd like to think myself as a decent player. In NBA 2K16, however, no matter your skill you are going to have a bad time scoring.And defense. Don't even get me started on defense. You'd think you would be able to defend the AI, since it can lock you down no matter what. But, of course, that's not the case. Unresponsive is the defining word of this game. It only takes one change of direction, one little crossover for the AI to get by you. Seriously, your controlled player takes around 3 seconds to change direction, so you just get left behind almost every time in defense. The AI just effortlessly gets by you.The AI is terrible, and in MyPlayer your teammates' AI is even worse. They often pass the ball to you at the worst time, lose the ball in a stupid way or try to do a tough fadeaway shot when they're being guarded by 3 defenders while you and the rest of your team is wide open. They NEVER box out, and there are times where you literally have to guard everyone in the court only to see your teammates allow an offensive rebound and easy score for the opposing team.The game forces you into the worst animations possible, making you miss the easiest shots possible.I could go on about the terrible Spike Lee story and dozens of other issues, but you got the picture. This game sucks. Don't waste your money on it. ♥♥♥♥ 2K Sports.

r 9, 2015
												Supposedly one of the greatest sports game in history is actually one of the most bs games in 2k history. Controls are all changed from what everyone is used to. The pick and rolls are now even harder to perform as the center or power forward takes a while to get into position or sets a screen for only a miniscule of a second. Shooting is disgusting because even the tiniest bit shy off of a perfect release or over would result in a miss, even in a situation where it's the most wide open shot. Passing is the same as usual, you try to pass to one guy but will pass to someone all the way across the court. Zig zag cheese is not gone as the CPU now zig zags you into their picks. In conclusion, the new mechanics of the game is what is actually ruining the gameplay and improvement was mainly focused on the different modes rather than gameplay itself.

												First and foremost: They gameplay is awesome and anyone who loves basketball will love NBA 2K16.So why would I NOT recommend this game?Publisher 2K simply doesn't care about its community enough. The support team is unable (or unwilling) to help and the community management absolutely fails to communicate with the player base. And that's only the icing on the cake. Since the beginning, there are a lot of cases of players losing their MyCareer character because of a corrupted safe file and not getting any compensation even if they bought their VC with real money or heavy lag online which basically persists since NBA2K13.So sadly I can absolutely not recommend NBA 2K16 even though it is an incredibly fun game simply because 2K gives a ♥♥♥♥ about its playerbase.

content:
ber 25, 2015
Do not buy if you only play MyCareerComing from a longtime 2K Sports fan, I have mixed feelings on this entry of NBA2K. However, just because I have it not recommended I suggest you read the entire review to see if you would like it.I am not going to get into day one issues like crashes, bugs, and server issues because frankly basing a review off that this early before they can fix things is stupid. But there are issues I PERSONALLY have with the game. But I'll say a few things this game offers over 2K15 first.ProsImproved animations definitely.Finally readded create-a-team for MyGM, MyLeague, MyTeam, and other online modes. (And its actually really good)Tattoos are freaking amazing and you can place them all over your body.These were a few off the top of my head I was pleased with.The IssueHowever, as I mentioned before I had a huge gripe with this game. In my personal opinion they seem to have taken a step back when it comes to MyCareer. Others apperently like it but I was extremely disappointed by the fact the "story" was stereotypical, thoughtless and not enjoyable. I expected more from Spike Lee & 2K. So with giving us an actual story (if you want to call it that) they severely limited how we can play. This isn't OUR story. It is Freq's story. Yes the protagonist has a name and even if you had a simple name like Joe Johnson they will still say Freq regardless. You do not have a choice to be called something else like in previous MyCareers (my personal choice was "Silky" Johnson) If you want to play a white, asian, hispanic or really any race that isn't black you have to suspend your disbelief that your family is black and you are not. To make matters worse you have a fraternal twin sister so you really cant think your mom cheated on your dad either. You can't win Rookie of the Year because you can only play a few games in your rookie season. The "story" is insanely short, badly written, predictable, pointless and a waste of time. They took away more of our choices and options so they could waste our time with that?You may be saying, but wait! Didn't they let you play through high school and college? That sounds fun. At first yes it was interesting to just destroy the high school competition and finally see some college basketball, but its exactly the same as a normal game just reskinned. You only play a few games of high school and a few of college then you get drafted. And after a handful of years MyCareer has been out, THEY STILL HAVENT ADDED A REACTIVE DRAFT. Meaning if you get drafted first, guess what? The Timberwolves get two number one picks. You and Karl Anthony-Towns. So the draft is basically pointless because it's always the same even though you are in it no matter what your position is. Sucks for you if you play PF and you get drafted first because you're gonna share minutes with a guy who shouldn't even be on the team. Teams won't draft based on needs either apparently, in fact its hard to say for sure what they'll draft on. But if you're a center for example expect Detroit, Utah, Sactown, and Orlando to want to draft you even if they have a franchise center because why not. Same for playing any other position, they will draft you regardless. They should have just placed the MyGM/MyFranchise draft AI into MyCareer so we could get SOME chance of being surprised even if they arent that great as well.Once the story ends, its basically MyCareer as last year.I feel so ashamed of 2K and Spike to have made this game mode such a huge selling point of the game. If you are considering getting the game because of MyCareer, do not get the game.If you don't care about MyCareerThe other gamemodes are solid, if you can can see past the cheesers, hackers, etc in online modes you'll have a lot of fun in ProAm, MyTeam and other game modes. Personally I play mostly MyLeague/MyGM and I enjoy it throughly even though I was hyped to play MyCareer. The relocation aspect of MyLeague/GM was sorely needed in previous entries and they finally added it and its actually good and not bare bones. You can upload images to use as the team's logo, court logo, advertisements, arena name. You can edit the court exactly how you want it, all black if you want to. You can also do this in online modes, create your own team and court which is what it needed. The animations are fluid and smooth. They changed the passing mechanics a bit and a few of the controls so it's an adjustment. Still slightly disappointed that 2K still hasnt revamped the draft prospect aspect of League/GM because its still extremely generic. They could at least pull a Madden and give the prospects a storyline and allow us to actually grow attached or get hyped for a prospect. I was also going to say they could give the random generated prospects faces but they still use the team jersey portraits (say if you trade Damian Lillard it changes from showing his real life counterpart to some nasty ultra low settings doppelganger) so there goes that. Overall however, aside from MyCareer its what you can expect from a yearly sports game release.

content:
r 7, 2015
												Really disappointed in the MyCareer mode, which is the only mode I played in this and 2k15.  It is a huge regression from last year for a number of reasons due to the way the story was put in place.  The biggest issues:1)  In your rookie NBA season, you only play 8 games.  After those 8 games, you move on to your sophomore season where you can then play a full 82 game season.  At this point, the game has sent players all over the place in free agency, so the teams are totally different than what they will be this season.  So for instance, I cannot play more than 8 games without Tim Duncan retiring.2)  The story is really stupid and feels forced upon you.  "The team isn't sure about signing you because you are friends with Vic."  Are you kidding?  And no matter how well you play, you get this way over-dramatic storyline that detracts from simply being a rookie trying to make it in the NBA.3)  There just simply isn't enough content in this game that responds to how you play in your games.  There were plenty of cut scenes in 2k15 that would cater to your performance.  For instance, the coach would call you in and congratulate you for your rebounding effort or how you distribute the ball to your teammates.  In this game I haven't seen any of that (though maybe I just haven't played long enough to see it).  All of the cut scenes in 2k16 play out just like a movie (a downright terrible one).  I play games for an immersive, interactive experience where my play affects the outcome.  This game is not that at all.

number of helpful: 58 of 102 people (57%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
ber 25, 2015
												Every year, basketball games like to brag about how much smoother and more fluid the game is. I think this is the first time it was very clear that a lot of things did improve. This is quite honestly the best basketball video game I have ever played.I haven't run into many performance issues, and the game runs much smoother for me at even higher settings than 2K15. Your mileage may vary, though. This game was designed with a controller, so I wouldn't recommend playing with a keyboard. The pro stick (RS) is essential to playing this game, and keyboards just won't offer you the same level of control.Most of the game modes in this year's game are pretty much similar to last year, but with more meat. In MyGM and MyLeague You can now relocate your team if you wish, and your owner can now give more dynamic goals (in GM). Also, AI logic is heavily improved and makes building a perfect team much more challenging, if not impossible. MyLeague also now has an online mode where you can play a League with your friends, similar to The Association Online from a few years back. MyTeam, along with the game modes present in the previous year, also has a new game mode called the Gauntlet, which is a 3 vs. 3 game against other MyTeams.The game now also has more online features than ever. MyPark makes a return from last year, which is pretty much the same, but now you also have a customizable MyCourt where you can invite your friends to play on. There is also the 2K Pro-Am mode which is similar to the Jordan Rec Center in the previous game, but not hidden behind the MyPark system. It also has a proper matchmaking system, which makes it much easier to get 10 people from around the world to get together to play a full 5-on-5 game. There is also Play Now Online which is basically a ranked online game mode where you can advance through different "leagues" which represent your skill level. Pretty similar to most other games' ranked matchmaking modes.MyCareer is in a weird place, where the game actually have already built a whole backstory for your created player. It has some weird quirks as I created a white player living in an African-American town, with African-American parents and an African-American twin sister. That takes the immersion out of the game mode a little. However, it is interesting in the way that you get to experience a custom curated story, unlike previous years where you're mostly just playing to increase your stats. You also now play through high school and college, which makes for an interesting experience, instead of just being thrown straight into the league.The presentation is also much improved. The menu interface is much slicker and more accessible than 2K15. The actual game also now has pre-show, halftime and post-game shows featuring Shaq, Ernie Johnson and Kenny Smith. The voice of the third commentator (replacing Steve Kerr) is awesome. There are also lots of player interviews which helps the atmosphere that you're watching a live TV broadcast. There are 50(!) in-game songs that make up the soundtrack which almost guarantees that you won't get tired of the playlist. Genres range from the standard rap/hip-hop to rock to pop and even some Spanish and one Korean song.And those are all great, but the best feature this game has is really how much better the actual basketball game is. Drives feel much smoother and traffic congestion within the paint is now no longer a problem if you run proper plays.  Defense is also much smoother and as a defender, I haven't found myself being left behind by the ball handler unless I make an actual mental error. The controls have changed, and there are now 3 pass buttons (seriously?), but the post trigger (LT) is a great idea and if you get used to the new controls, it actually feels more natural than the previous games. And of course, learn how to use the pro stick for best results.I'm sure if I play more hours of the game, I'll start to notice some annoying quirks. However, 5 hours and counting with the game and I can say that this is the most fun I have with a basketball video game. Even when you're losing, you're still having fun because the game doesn't feel like it's forcing invisible walls for you to get through.If you're interested in basketball, and you haven't played a basketball video game in a while, NBA 2K16 is the one to play.

Older NBA games such as NBA 2K13 had the interviews after each game. That was pretty fun and enjoyable, since the questions changed according to the way you played the game and the result of that game. Feature got cut. NBA 2K15 - interviews at halftime/after the game with the player - feature got cut. Talking to the GM about the team/playstyle of the team? Feature got cut. Almost nothing changes, exact same commentary lines every year, barely any new animations, ♥♥♥♥♥iest shooting release ever. If you couldn't be asked to read (which I know I wouldn't) - don't buy this game, an honest waste of money.

												Well, after one day of playing the 2K16 I can say there aren't as many changes as I hoped. There is also a HUGE RACIST issue with MyCAREER mode. I play a 6'8" WHITE dude, but still - his twin sibling is a black girl, which would be possible if their parents were an interracial couple, but they're both black too! If the issue was the opposite, you'd want to play a black kid and both parents and his twin sibling was black, there would be a HUGE scandal for days now. Don't know who to thank for, I think Spike Lee could say something about that - I remember him complaining that Clint Eastwood had failed to include a single African-American soldier in his films Flags of Our Fathers and Letters from Iwo Jima, both about the 1945 battle for the Japanese island. Eastwood justified his choice of actors, saying that those black troops who did take part in the battle as part of a munitions company didn't raise the flag. So I suppose that Spike Lee defied reality and made white players to have a black background. It's just stupid and ignorant. There's only one world in his mind - New York City (Harlem especially) and only one race - BLACK. Keeping up with the story makes you facepalm twice an hour. Nevertheless, the game itself is almost pretty good, the tracklist choice is AWESOME. For now, I give it a strong 7/10. If you have NBA 2K15 you can easily stick with it. Still, if there will be NBA 2K17 next year, I certainly won't buy it before the official release and then some solid opinions form other sources.

ber 29, 2015
												Let's set this straight, the gameplay itself is fun and well polished when it's working.  However the amount of bugs along with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ MyCareer really forces me to not recommend this game.  The online works fine for the most part, no real connection issues, ProAm and all of those things are a nice addition.   I had a HUGE issue when I first started playing the game, I went into the graphic options and messed around.  I DISABLED V-sync and dynamic V-sync along with all of this, after applying the changes, the game froze and crashed.  So I then restarted the game and it began to run at 1FPS, luckily I remembered that 2k15 had a similar problem albiet less intense.  So I went into appdata/roaming and opened up the config file, only to see that the v-sync options were still enabled. I disabled those and launched the game again, now running at 200fps.List of bugs I've encountered:-FPS issue above-When subbing back in during MyCareer the player info pane never appears, forcing me to quit to the menu and reload-Player is litterally stuck in an animation when a pass or rebound is taken away at the wrong time.  You have to wait till the possesion is over-Some freethrows count for 2 points, then resulting in the team shooting to get the ball back.-The menu when you choose to either hang out/train or advance get's stuck on screen DURING the gameIf 2k patched out those problems the game wouldn't necessarily be better, just less annoying to play.  MyCareer is ♥♥♥♥, no real choices like they advertised, and you still have to pay for ♥♥♥♥ing accessories like socks with VC.  I only bought this game because it was on sale at GMG.  If it was full price, no way in hell would I have bought it.  There are just not enough changes to justify the full price for this game.

content:
r 2, 2015
												At it's current state, I don't recommend this game, not even if you get it from a gray key site. No, not becuase "This game is racist because my family is always black and BLAH BLAH BLAH" (those people need help if the really feel like that's racism). I don't recommend it because of what really matter: the gameplay.Now the game has made some improvements over last year, like some animations are better, it's not as easy to make shots as it was in the last game, slightly better player customization, the rival of MyCrew via the new ProAm mode (even if we can't play on our courts yet), MyCourt, some bugs/glitches fixed, etc. However there's a lot of new issues in the game, incuding some from the old game. For example, Demigods and hackers are back on MyPark. People have had 99 overalls since the day came out for people who preordered and managed to get things outside of their rank (skateboards, shirtless option, mascot gear, etc). Speaking of MyPark, the servers are very hit or miss. Either it runs smoothly or everyone lags the entire time and the game runs like a slideshow. Also there's an issue with the Got Next spots that sometimes happens that prevents anyone from getting on them. Also, that 1v1v1 mode they have in MyPark is kinda lame, but that's just me nitpicking.Moving onto MyCareer, it's also kind of a mess. The story is lame. I understand them wanting you to feel like a high school/college phenom, nad those games were fun, but once you get drafted is where I have issues with it. You're being being drafted amongst player that have ratings in the upper 70s (probably some in the lower 80s as well) but your overall is at a 55 to start, and yet the characters in the story talk about you potentially going lottery pick in the draft. The rookie season is only 8 games, which isn't that bad, except you basically get no VC at that point so you don't rank up that much going into your 2nd season. Also they advertised the new MyCareer story to make you think it's all about choices, but you really don't until you finish the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t story. The only choice you get is the college you go to, and even then you only get about 10(?) choices for schools. Once your rookie season is over is when you actually get to make choices, which I enjoy. I like that you get to choose how you spend your off days, even though I wish you'd get more VC out of endorsements (since it doesn't seem like you make that much in games, regardless of how wellyou do).The biggest issue I have with the game, however, is the stability. Whenever I do MyCareer or Play Now games, my frames drop a lot, the game stutters, and the game crashes a lot. The game sometimes switches from full screen to windowed mode for no reason no matter what my settings are. All in all, I'd say just wait for a patch before you buy the game.

number of helpful: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
er 31, 2015
												I play the NBA 2k games every year because basketball is my favorite sport and NBA 2k is, unfortunately, the only halfway decent sim on the market.  The problem with this is that they have no pressure to get their ♥♥♥♥ together.I gave this game a positive review after playing maybe 10 hours because some basic issues with NBA 2k15 were fixed.  The movement feels more fluid than in that game.  NBA 2k15 is without a doubt the worst NBA 2k game ever made.  This is probably the 2nd worst game in the franchise though.  A new review is being written after playing many more hours.  I only play so many hours because I assume problems with the game are my own lack of skill for a bit, until you really get to notice specific problems.  I also just love basketball and keep getting fooled every year.  And it's such a shame because NBA 2k14 on next-gen console, not PC, had such great potential to be improved dramatically in the following years.  They removed all their progress for God knows what reason.The big draw is that Spike Lee did the MyCareer mode, and frankly it's by far the worst career mode in any sports game I've ever played, or any game with any mode even remotely comparable.  They put you in a Spike Lee film basically, except Spike Lee was obviously not allowed to make something like he'd actually put in a film (most of his films are R rated and this game is E rated, so you can imagine all the things he'd have to censor himself about).So they make your character's background be this incredibly stereotypical borderline offensive plotline, something which would be called racist if Spike didn't do it because it'd be called a parody of black life in New York.  You use 90s rap slang in a modern setting and have all kinds of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t happen which doesn't actually move the plot of you being a basketball player forward.  I'm shocked Big Daddy Kane didn't have a writing credit.  You play like 8 games, 4 high school 4 college, to determine your draft slot.  Not a terrible idea by itself.  But they paint your character the whole time as being this godsend of a player.  Think of the way Lebron was anticipated as a kid out of high school.  Yet, if you spend no VC on your character before the draft, he comes in as a 55 overall.  This makes your player the worst in the league, literally.This is problematic for 2 major reasons: (other than the absurdity of being painted as Lebron and then coming in to be the worst in the league by far). 1) College and high school games are a complete waste of time.  Draft position couldn't matter less in any context, just your own role playing.  I normally care about draft position in these games, but they also usually care more about how I play during MyCareer in return.2) You cannot skip this for new players.After you're drafted, they only let you play 8 games of your first season.  It's abysmal.  Also, Spike's story actually has nothing to do with your real NBA career, i.e. the reason you're playing.  All it does is give you 2 hours of cutscenes interspersed between the pointless high school and college games.  There's hardly any actual story once you're a bonafide NBA player, which defeats the entire purpose of the mode.  The only thing you get are "meetings" with some select few famous players, and that's not actually anything more than clicking on menus and seeing some kind of a stat or VC boost at best.The MyGM mode is plagued with the practice time issue.  It becomes a nuissance immediately.  The mode itself is pretty easy, it's nowhere near as complex as something like Out of the Park Baseball is, obviously, but it's probably as bad as its ever been.  The trade logic, despite promises to the contrary, is equal to how bad it always is.  There's always so many dumb trades you can pull off.  It boggles my mind that the game allows such game breaking trades to be made.And the gameplay itself: again, the game feels better than it did last year, but not better than 2k14, and not better than almost any other year before that.  The shot meter is the one thing I like, and even that is bad half the time because you'll regularly miss perfectly aligned shot meter shots.  It defeats the purpose of the meter if you miss midrange jumpers with an 88 overall player on a perfectly in the green shot.The game feels like one of those old hockey tabletop games where all the players are stuck to the floor and you can only rotate them to shoot in a puck.  The players feel stuck to the floor.  They are moved against gravitational logic into positions to contest shots in ways which, after watching replays, make you want to tear your hair out.  The AI still cheeses with the shots it takes and makes.  The teammate AI in the MyCareer mode is, honestly, worse than it was even last year.  It makes it so that on high difficulty you can average over 40 a game and a triple double and still lose by 20.  How am I supposed to win when I get double'd, pass it out to open guys who can't hit shots that I'd make in real life?  2k NEEDS to get their act straight because the game suffers immensely.On PC the multiplayer modes have low populations.  The one mode which doesn't, where you take your MyCareer player to the park, has strange limitations.  If you don't choose to rep the park with the beach and the aquarium, you'll basically be left all by yourself in the ironworks park with no one to play with.  That mode has tons of hackers and cheaters in it, based on the complaints on the forums as well as what I've seen myself.  I haven't done much of that mode because the people who play that mode play almost exclusively that and you'll get killed repeatedly.  I'm really good at full team vs team basketball but the population is too low to rise in rank on that mode, all the people who play that regularly are already all at the top ranks.  You aren't allowed to play with higher ranked people for some reason in spite of population issues, it's a terrible design choice.And the VC gouging.  Everything costs more.  More money.  Pat Riley talked about the disease of more, where people wanted more playing time and more money for themselves to break up a potentially winning basketball team.  Who knew that you could also apply it to a video game franchise about basketball?  This game feels like the biggest cash grab yet, and that's saying a lot given the antics of last year's game.  They kept the terrible ♥♥♥♥ing system of upgrading stats in blocks, and now you have even stricter limits on your player's ability to rise in rank.  I'm stuck at 88 overall, I can't figure out what I'm supposed to do to be allowed to go higher in rank.And come on, 1000 VC for a ♥♥♥♥ing headband?  It's disgusting.  Absolutely disgusting.  I'm a fool for buying the game every year but I just love basketball so damn much.  If the Out of the Park guys made an NBA or even fictional basketball manager sim, I'd buy that in a heartbeat.  All the games that exist of that nature are awful, I've looked, so don't point me to that terrible basketball manager game that's on Steam.  And if those guys are reading this, you too should get your act together because there's money to be made and a complete void in this market.  If somebody came along and gave us a good basketball game, we'd all play it.P.S. It's a game where the players in real life actually are able to do better things than in this game.  It's a basketball game where you can't ever actually dunk on someone because of the flawed defense system.  There's still problems with height advantage in this game, a basic ♥♥♥♥ing concept in basketball.  This game is about a 55 overall, same as the rating they start your MyPlayer at.  But if they spend money, they can pay me and I'll upgrade their rating.  Or maybe just work on the gameplay this year?  And yes the 2kTV girl is hot but is 2kTV really a necessary feature?  It's just a waste of resources that should be going into the actual product.

content:
, 2016
												The "story" by Spike Lee is just stupid.- you create a caucasian player, but your family is african-american- your twin sister is african-american- your name is Frequency Vibrations............I did not get past my draft, because I couldn't even laugh at the story anymore.Everything in this game is very cinematic. You press something in the menu - whoosh whoosh baaam Steph Curry shooting for 3 points and then you can do something.There are so many cinematics in game that you cannot skip. Someone fouls, you have to watch the cheerleaders for 3 seconds. Someone gets fouled, something has to fly over your monitor before you can shoot. Oh, and then you get to 4th quarter.4th quarter in this game is absolute hell. Timeouts every 10 seconds, which means that you can't play for another 10 seconds, because the timeout animation can't be skipped. This happens maybe 3-4 times 4th quarter and some times before. And if you play a close game, then the players start fouling each other, which makes sense from a basketball point of view (probably), but I get pretty irritated when my players do something I did not tell them to do. Last 30 seconds of 4th quarter take about 2-3 minutes to play out and after 3 games it becomes a drag.If you want to play some basketball on PC, you have no other choice. And sometimes the games can feel pretty good, but everything in this game apart from the actual basketball is just dumb.

number of helpful: 13 of 20 people (65%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
3, 2016
Summary/Overview NBA 2k16 is the most recent in cutting edge technology acclaimed for a decade now by fans, critics, game reviewers and writers as the premier and ultimate experience for a pure basketball simulation that remains bar none to its other former competitor, NBA Live made by Electronic Arts. Gameplay (Features, controls, graphics & mechanics) Features  Game Modes    There are so many game modes that for the sake of the review length limit I am allowed to produce on Steam, I can't go in-to-depth on all of them. Thus, I will discuss the game modes I have taken time out to play. Those are Play now, my Career & My GM.    The play now game mode is what all of us 2k sports consumers have grown to love over time for those of us that have played 2K basketball before. However, for those of you that have never played a 2KXX game in your life, it is synonymous with quick game where it gives you the option to play in the NBA today matchups which update every single time the NBA season as a whole progresses and then the most common game mode being where you choose a team and then choose who your opponent's team will be if you are playing against the computer.  Presentation in Play Now    The presentation has improved over outdated NBA 2k games such as NBA 2k12 and even now NBA 2k14. It is much more realistic showing pre-game rituals, pre-game warm-ups, half-time shows, a message time to time from a player with their thoughts on things when they are interviewed and finally a post-game analysis with ShaQ, Kenny Smith and Ernie Johnson. The reflections upon the light reflected off of the court is accurate to a tee representing the hardwood floors in an exact 1:1 replica portion of the real thing in the NBA. My favorite part overall of this is when the public announcers announce all the famous cliché sayings all of us have grown to love over time. These include sayings such as, " Rockets ball", "Detroit Basketball! " and so much more.    Growing up in Houston, Texas half of my life at my current age of twenty-three, my Dad would win off of the radio many NBA tickets in the various states we have lived being Houston, Texas; Oregon and even Mississippi to see the Memphis Grizzles. I used to appreciate the announcers the most because of their personality and charisma. I still to this day while playing 2k sports national basketball association games, absolutely love teams that have a good announcer with a great personality, the way that they are able to craft the names is what still brings me in. My favorite teams currently based on their announcers alone in the way they say player's names in order are: Detroit Pistons, Denver Nuggets, Cleveland Cavs, Houston Rockets and the Miami Heat.    Now I will get into my primary disappointment within NBA 2k16. They took out some of the signature animations they had put in NBA 2k14 and other ones near that year such as when LeBron James goes over to the mat near the sideline to wipe off his feet while rubbing lotion together as it disperses in the air during his famous pre-game clap. I miss this so much. Another example are some key points dealing with Kobe Bryant. Some of his same signature behaviors we have come to know and love have now been eradicated, null, non-existent. For example, if you want it to be accurate in a 1:1 ratio, Rasheed Wallace, yes I know he is retired now but we will just use him right now to illustrate this example along with Metta World Peace (Formerly Ron Artest). Rasheed is known as a class clown that picks on teammates and is very displeased when the referees call something that goes against his favor.      He should be seen in-game with behaviors that promote foolery and arrogance. Ron Artest on the other hand, now still currently active in the 2K series and known as Metta World Peace now should have his signature move of patting his teammates on the butt, because he always does that often and it is unique to his personality and character upon the court.    Through this review, I have only had the opportunity to thoroughly try out two different teams in quick match, the Milwaukee Bucks and the Houston Rockets.  1. The Milwaukee Bucks    The Bucks play just like they do in the actual national basketball association. Each team is designed in a 1:1 ratio to play based on whether they are a team that shoots the lights out normally from mid and three-point range (e.g., Warriors, Cavs, Heat, Spurs & Thunder). Other teams that are excellent defensively but slower down the court offensively (e.g., Celtics, Bulls, Pacers, Hawks & Grizzlies). The bucks are a primary offensive team, they push the ball up the court fast, usually nail buckets from mid-range and even three-point range pretty easily and always get toward the free-throw-line. 2. The Houston Rockets    The Houston Rockets are one of the safest teams to use all around in NBA 2k16 and beyond and here is why. Since the Rockets have acquired Jason Terry, James Harden and Dwight Howard, they are a good threat, and force the defender to know the mechanics it operates under.  I have been playing the Houston Rockets so long in NBA Live and NBA 2k, that I now fully recognize how the whole team's chemistry works despite what players they have. They share the ball like the Spurs do, dominate you in the paint, work it out to mid-range and push the tempo at a steady pace to get up in your face and make you question the team's interior, exterior motives. I won't lie, I do miss not having Kevin Martin, but, instead, now there is James Harden on the Rockets which perfectly takes his place and he is much healthier.My Career Mode    My career mode is a brand new edition this year by the direction of Spike Lee in order to include a storyline for the first time in a simulated basketball game. Highlights: Production quality matches Grand Theft Auto V voice overs, graphics and emotion. You play in the life of a guy named Freq surrounded by his twin sister, Cee-Cee and his best friend, Vic (Short for Victor). Freq is a straight A student out of high school distinguished by honors and is from Harlem so him and his friends use urban slang in their dialect. GM Mode    It is best defined as a mode in which you become the general manger of any team you want while controlling finances, assets, accounting, projections, recruiting new free agents, players on your team and signing them to contracts. You work for the owner of your team and are not allowed to disappoint, you have to learn responsibility, resource; time-management and humility in order to survive the simulated life of what real-life general managers in sports face up against daily, weekly and monthly.Pros & ConsPros•Excellent atmosphere, production quality, storyline, new features, new game modes, presentation and graphics•Fun, easily enjoyable and endlessly replayable•It can replace the NBA for those that don't keep up with the games on television any•Accuracy in character models, the 2015 NBA draft selections, team dynamics, player tendencies, behaviors and reactions•The best 2k game since NBA 2k7 and NBA 2k12Cons•Online matches crash often on the PC, so be wary of that•Laggy online connection when playing online with others normally•Some player's signature behaviors through non-verbal cues have been taken out but have been replaced and made betterOverall- 10 

Key
1-3 = poor
4-5 = ok
6-7 = good
8-10 = amazing

For more objective non-biased reviews, please visit my other account TheDragonsNiche (2)
Alternate Steam PC Account Link: https://steamcommunity.com/id/InsightfulJourney

content:
y 24, 2016
												It's not that NBA2K16 is a bad game, it's just not a really good game. And when they're charging AAA prices for it, I can't really recommend it. The pros:- Interesting and plenty of online and offline game modes- Good graphics (if you can run it)- It's better than NBA Live and one of the only sports games left still available on PCCons:- Clunky controls and animations. Even in offline mode the controls are clunky and feel unpolished. Animations finish slowly even in high energy situations like when youre on a fast break or when youre stuck in the paint trying to pass the ball. I constantly deal with things like my player receiving a wide open pass on a fast break, but he takes the pass with no urgency so by the time the catch animatino is over and my jump shot animation begins, I'm covered. There are many many more examples of clunky controls and animations getting in the way. I could go on for paragraphs. Very frustrating.- Mostly luck based. Want to do anything besides post up cheese? I hope youre feeling lucky. Drive the basket? Maybe you'll do an awesome move, freeze your defender and score, maybe you'll get blocked. Jump shots are by far the worst. You can never tell when they are going to drop. Wide open, fully contested. There seems to be little rhyme or reason to them. I understand real life basketball can often be like this as well, but trust me.... in this game it's very difficult to develop a strategy besides get a guy open and pray. Or just cheese up the post.- Lag. The online lag is often unbearable. Sometimes it's good, most of the time it's not. They rely on p2p connections which can be confusing to some players causing lag for everyone in the match.- Buggy. Never remembers account info. This game tells me every other day that my account is expired and I have to re-enter all the information. I get my account back, but it's a process. I have tried everything on the support page to solve this. It also happens in the mobile companion app.- Buggy. I literally have to change my controller setup every game. The pro stick by default is used for dribbling and shooting so I turn it to dribble only plus absolute. Every. Game. Every game after I hit it and notice it's reverted back resulting in breaking up my play.- Buggy. Every single day when I play guantlet, the first match I can't move. Like my character literally can't move. I have to alt+tab, kill process, try again and it's fixed. This means every day I have to start my online play with a loss.- Buggy. Many random and lazy bugs. Like your character not putting his arms on the table in interviews.. they sort of oddly float. I have no idea how that passed QA. Your arms or jaw will just random shake when on the bench. And many more things like this.- Spike Lee. I won't even elaborate on this as it's been done to death. Just google "LIVIN' DA DREAM" and you'll know what I want to say since nobody has anything good to say about it.I could easily go on with the cons. Yes, all games have bugs and minor problems, but in NBA2k16 they seem to stack up. They stack up and weigh against very few good things about the game. Considering this is your only option to play Basketball on PC, I guess I could recommend it based on that. If you could live with or whithout a basketball game though, then I would recommend you save your money.

number of helpful: 17 of 28 people (61%) found this review helpful
content:
5, 2016
												2K Games’ NBA series has proven to be the basketball game of choice over the last few years, much more popular than EA’s Live brand. One of the main reasons behind this is the constant drive to evolve and provide memorable experiences. Some have entries have been excellent, like the previous NBA 2K15, while others, such as 2K14 left a bit of bad taste behind due to various constraints.NBA 2K16 isn’t the biggest departure from 2K15, but there is one major difference and that is the change to the MyCareer mode. Film director Spike Lee has brought his experience to the mode and added a story that has a big impact on the rookie season of the MyCareer mode. In this mode you control a person called Frequency Vibrations, or Freq for short – that isn’t his real name, which is left to you as you create the player. If you have saved data from 2K15 then you can import the player from that game, though only his appearance will transfer over and not attributes.The Spike Lee directed portion of MyCareer is called Livin’ Da Dream, and sees you go from high school, to college and then the NBA. It is a different approach to what we saw previously, as you shape Freq’s choices, such as the university he goes too, so that I ended up at the University Of Kansas. The acting is well done by all that were involved, and seeing your player’s history unfold in such a fashion is an interesting idea.However for Livin’ Da Dream to work, a major component of MyCareer has been cut down, and that is the rookie season in the NBA. It is still there, but it’s been reduced from a full 82 game season to just eight games from different points of the season, with a couple more at the end if your team reaches the play-offs. I honestly don’t know why 2K chose to cut such a major piece of the game, especially since the story doesn’t make up for the reduction.The rookie season has traditionally been where a lot of player growth and development is done. Each match can see you improve as you acquire more points to increase attributes with, and if you’re good enough, you can even compete for Rookie of the Season. At least, you could. Here there is no chance to try for that accolade, and the fewer games mean that in the second season of MyCareer your Freq is much lower rated than others players at the same point in their careers within the game.There have been other additions to MyCareer which do add to the experience of being a pro basketball player. Your agent helps you get endorsements and you can also hang out with players from around the league. These options are available on your off days, so you can get some points shooting a promo or potentially do some networking should you decide to spend the day with others. You can also choose to train on your off day and try to improve skills from there. However, these options are only available from the second season onwards, due to the Livin’ Da Dream being the most important aspect of your rookie season.As before, the best mode for play with an entire team would be MyGM, in which you control everything from team roster, the way the budget can be allocated, and the action on the court. Each team’s owner will have different goals for you to achieve with the squad, be it making the play-offs or winning the championship. You’ll field press conferences too with the answers given affecting how the team see you, and how the media views you.NBA 2K16 does play well, with team movement seeming to be more fluid, and the way the ball is passed about a lot more. The AI is challenging but not to the point where it is frustrating, with each team having their advantages and disadvantages. Neither opposition AI nor team AI is infallible and occasionally mistakes will be made, like a pass being thrown too early or the ball being stolen leading to a turnover.Team mates will usually run into the correct lanes so you have an easier time of passing around, or defending when needs be. Fouling also seems to be less of an issue than previous games too, allowing for the matches to move forward with fewer interruptions, and you can choose to call a time-out and manually sort out substitutions, or allow the game to do it automatically for you.On the multiplayer side of things you can play locally and online competitively. MyPark allows for you to team with other individuals to play matches against others, while MyTeam is the mode where you can collect players through opening card packs or obtain them through picks after winning certain games. The goal is to create a highly rated team as well as collect every card possible, which will take quite some time, since there are over 2400 of them. Online leagues are back too so if you have a group of friends to play NBA 2K16 with it is definitely worth setting up.NBA 2K16 isn’t a huge jump over NBA 2K15 in the graphics department, but it remains an incredible looking game. The commentary also continues to be the best of any sports game so far, and with the addition of the pre and post game shows to MyCareer, you get much more analysis of players and teams through the game.

content:
ry 14, 2016
												The game has it's flaws. The graphics are gorgeous. But the gameplay has become intolerable. You spend most of the time trying to get the player to move where you want them to move. I don't know what it is, but when a path is open and you push that direction, there is no reason for that player not to move there (no matter how bad their stats are) So instead you will continuously press harder in that direction (don't do this, eventually your controller will break).My biggest gripe is the "My Career" mode. It's not moving in the right direction drama-wise. Before I bought the game, I read all of the criticisms regarding the Spike Lee story and didn't think it could be that bad. It was BAD. It was basically a bunch of LONG cutscenes that are incredibly boring, there is nothing interesting about the story. I remember Spike Lee movies having a little oomph to them but this story was vanilla and played out like a Tyler Perry story. Painful. Besides that, it is the same ol' become a NBA player and get mandatory endorsements (I would rather endorse a cheap shoes like Starburys) and become a corporate shill, just how the NBA is supposed to be.  But those things aren't the worst part about My Player, it is the slow pace that you get VC. They intentionally gimped the amount you get to entice you to buy some online. Like a free-to-play game.  And you almost have to buy it because your player starts off awful stat-wise. My character was a  pg whose stats are so bad it is painfully obvious that they don't belong in the NBA let alone have teams competing for their services. No rookie of the year possibilities (I'm not even sure if it's possible)When your stats are bad, your passes go to the defenders. While playing defense your character automatically RUNS AWAY from offensive players. Opposing defenders don't allow you to effing MOVE and when you try to move (spamming turbo)... turnover. (same crap as the other version) so nothing different there.  Boring post game press conferences supplant the obnoxious cut scenes in season 2, it's just not worth it (in MY Career at least)  Fun!I am a huge NBA fan, and would like to play a basketball RPG for once that I could relate to, but year after year, the same basic premise and actor. The direction they take My Career is so far removed from who I am IRL, I lose immersion. Instead of changing the formula up, they double down on the formula. Who asked for this? So, be warned. Then again, this is just my opinion.

content:
y 28, 2016
												Okay, I feel obligated to actually post a review from the standpoint of someone who actually enjoys the game. There are many positives to the game if you play it with the correct mindset. However, with that being said, there are a few issues that are rather annoying when they pop up.MyCareer- Spike Lee screwed up the mode quite a bit, but once you get past the storyline, it is better than ever. BUT the storyline, is absolutely hilarious due to the fact that I am a white Point Guard who acts not like the average black man, but the average ghetto, uneducated thug. Good for a laugh for sure but definitely a bit unrealistic, considering that you have a black twin sister. It is just a story mode until the end of your rookie season, and then the choice is all yours as to how you do things. MyTeam- Great gamemode if you put enough time into it. Any game you play will have one or two players who bought their way to skill. There will always be that one guy who just dumped a bunch of money in the game and therefore is automatically at an advantage. The other big problem with player vs player is the fact that there are many ways for you, not neccesarily to have an advantage, but play in a not so polite manner. Spamming three pointers is very easy especially in modes like gauntlet so beware because most people do it. The same goes with Zig-Zagging and other tactics that lead me to question the amount of fun that they might be having. Also the computer is infuriating at every turn. The game is designed to make it challenging, so you will end up missing wide open three pointers and dunks but the computer, somehow dunks on everyone and shoots threes fading over centers. Sucks, but deal with it because there is nothing that you can do to combat it. No matter how good of ball handles your player has, you are prone to suddenly dropping the ball at random points. Game Quality- So despite the problems I just mentioned, the game itself isn't that bad. If you have an older computer or a lower quality computer, than you may have to lower the game settings in the menu. Does it suck, yes, but you get used to it. Most of the people who have lag and framerate issues are trying to run the game on max settings on a computer that has the gaming ability and power of a microwave. Don't blame the game for your bad computer. Overview- Worth the buy for sure, but like every game has its issues. You will enjoy the game if you have regular expectations. I love the game and we need more people on the online servers so the game is worth the money.

content:
0, 2016
												NBA2K16, the game and series as well, truely expresses my love for the game of basketball.  Basketball is actually my one true passion in real life, aside from playing video games.For me, it is an escape and it is unlike any other sports video game.  Like, if I could I'll play this game for 24 hours in each day, I would but I shouldn't coz that would be insane. My very first ever basketball video game was Double Dribble on console and NBA Live 97 for PC.  From then on, I've gotten a hold of every NBA Live basketball game on PC up to 2008.  NBA 2k9 by 2K Sports was my first game fom the company and it change everything for me BIG TIME.  Compared to EA Sports' NBA Live, 2K Sports' version of the game is the best bar none.   No. No, I don't want to hear your NBA Live argument. It's the best basketball video game and that is it for me. 2K Sports' version got it right for me in every single way.  The speed, fluidity of movement, the level of player detail, the shoes and accessories, etc. This video game is almost the same as real life basketball...not really LOL.My only rant about the game is when you play MyPark.  I am pretty much an average player but most players there should learn how to play like a team and learn how pass the ball specially to the open guy.  "Hey!!! Look I'm open, are you blind, WTH?"  Moreover, most if not all should definitely learn how to play defense.  More often than not, your teamates only knows one (1) play, and that is, pass it to him  and get out of his freakin' way, again WTF.  Sadly, that is not how to play the game.  But seriously, NBA2K16 for me has become a channel for letting go of my life, my thoughts, my worries and my burdens.  I cannot complete my day without playing this game.  In real life, I cannot go more than a week without feeling the touch of a basketball.  For pure hoop fans, I recommend this game.NOTE: I play basketball on a keyboard and if you ever been beaten by yours truely, just keep that in mind - again by a keyboard player.  Peace out.

content:
ry 15, 2016
												Disclaimer: I almost exclusively play MyCareer and MyPark so that's what my review is about. After finishing incredibly boring and distasteful first season (Spike Lee shenanigans), it turns into a pretty good game. Rebounding is seriously improved over the past few editions, and park is better balanced (still not perfect, of course, but at least it's not full of 7'3 people). Stat caps are serious business this time around, and they really help that balance. However, it does mean that you hit the wall pretty early in terms of progression and then it gets really slow afterwards. Graphics are really nice and the game works fine for me in 4k on a single 980ti (60 FPS, no hiccups). Bit of a downside is that MyCareer still doesn't offer proper challenge and balance at higher difficulties. For example on Superstar, my team will simply lose more games than on All-Star, but I am still able to average around triple double (31-11-9) on my All-Around SF in 2nd season. Seems that increasing the difficulty just makes your team miss more, and other team hit absurd shots. But then again, this is really no different than before.

content:
ber 18, 2016
"An almost perfect release"Technical analysis summaryGraphics: 8.5Sound: 8.5Playability: 8.5Longevity: 9.0Impact: 8.0Pro+ All the charm of the NBA world, faithfully recreated+ Several game modes to suit all tastes+ Interesting story mode with a superb cast+ Meeting other online players and see their styles in the park is funny...Cons- ...but meeting tons of cheaters is absolutely not!- Still need some improvements when is about physical contact between players and animations- Needs better roster management: some historic teams don't have their key players and the Euroleague receives way delayed updates- Sometimes shots and passes look "predetermined" despite the timing of the playerOverall Verdict8.5: Technically solid and with plenty of game modes, for both single and multi player, the 2016 version of NBA 2K is confirmed as the best basketball simulation game available on the market.An excellent title that basketball fans will fully appreciate, suitable for both veterans of the series, who will be amazed by the improvements, and newbies who want to approach the series, thanks to the satisfying learning curve that the game offers. Not totally optimized for competitive online games on PC._______________Steam Optimization as of 18/09/2016[tested with Win 10 Pro - 64 bit - Version 1607- OS Build 14393.187, MoBo MSI Z170A Gaming Pro - FW Build 1.B0, Intel i7 6700k, Gigabyte GeForce GTX 970 Xtreme Gaming Edition - Driver Version 372.70, Kingston Hyper X 8x2 GB 2666 MHz, game and steam client installed on Western Digital Blue 3TB model WD30EZRZ-00Z5HB0]As usual when talking about NBA 2K games, the title faced technical issues throughout the year. Some issues were promptly repaired, others required a longer period to be fixed (remarkable was an online-breaking bug following the Windows 10 anniversary update which impeded almost all the players to connect to the servers for more than one week) while others were never totally resolved (such as the above mentioned online cheaters issue). All in all a well optimized and supported game which, however, didn't really favor the players who wanted to participate in competitive gaming.

content:
ber 29, 2015
												If 2K fixes the bugs, I'll make this review positive. Maybe..  "Contains spoilers"MyCareerFirst of all, lets talk about Spike Lee's "Livin da dream" story to MyCareer. The story is stereo typical on the highest level possible. I made a  white player, but my whole family is black. Slang words in every sentece is frustrating to hear and watch(subtitles). Conversations are so unreal, stupid and too long.. And you cant even choose your own nickname. So prepare to be called one thing and only ONE THING. The story starts in High School which is pretty cool. 2K tries to add an nice atmosphere, and it's actually decent. After the High School games which are apoximately 4 games(2min quarters), you are getting offers from several Colleges around the country. Then you choose the college you want to attend to and 8 college games later, you are littereally in the NBA. I dont know why 2K want you to rush through theese stages. They should allow you to choose between how many games you want to play, aswell as how many minutes the quarter should last. Because in the end, it doesn't feel real at all. After you get drafted to the NBA, your first season will likewise only be 8 games and then you become a free agent. Luckily after you have chosen your new team, during free agency the main story ends and you can move on with the game and your career. Your second season in MyCareer is where it all falls back into place. It feels like home again and I was actually starting to enjoy the game because I could play throughout a whole season, making endorsements, connections and so on for my player. Pro-Am New to this year's 2K is Pro-Am. I have been looking forward to it, and it was one of the first things I tried out when i started up the game. This game mode is better than "MyPark", and especially if you have a couple of friends to play with. It's a 5v5 game, where you control your MyPlayer amongside others, either you team up or you simply just join and wait for 9 others. This game mode has a unique feature, where you can build your own team from the buttom and have friends to join in and play for it. You are able to design and UPLOAD!! your own logo, shirt, arenas and even the scorer's table advertisements! I have already made my hometown's team "Aalborg Vikings", designed their jerseys so they look 100% as they do in real life. Costomized their homecourt aswell, and added real advertisements. Let me just say, that I cant wait for my friends to join in!

number of helpful: 25 of 45 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
r 3, 2015
												This is a tough review to write because there are some things that are really great about this game and others that are really bad.  First of all, if you don't have a new nvidia card then dont even bother because it is not optimised for anything else.  I have a gtx 970 so i can play it pretty much maxed though.  I am going to talk about the my career mode mainly since thats all I have really played and it is pretty much what I buy 2k for.  The problem with this game is the story kind of ruins it.  Your family is black even if you make a white character and the story is really cheese and you don't actually get any choice in any big decisions for your character.  The cut scenes are 20 min long even though they could be summed up in a 1 min scene.  The story definitely affects your character too much.  You don't get to decide what type  of person you want your player to be- spike lee decides that for you.  He also decides that you will leave college after your first year even though they make such a big deal over what a huge decision it is.  One of the biggest issues is that you dont get to play your rookie year.  You only play 8 games and you have no chance to make the playoffs.  Also, your ratings in this game start out at the lowest ever.  only about a 50 overall.  And best of all, you make no vc at all for the high school or college games.  And since you only play 8 games in your first season, you pretty much go into your second season with that same rating.  I think that this is just greed on 2k's part trying to get you to buy vc because if you didnt preorder the game for the extra 10k vc and you are just playing from the starting rating it is really brutal to try and progresss.  It is basically like taking a middle school kid and throwing him in to play with professionals.  It is really annoying to see this happen in a game that I paid 60 bucks for.  And, after all this hype over the story, it ends after the first season.  The story really ♥♥♥♥ed up this game and I really think 2k should just give you an option to skip it entirely and just play your first season as normal.So that is a lot of bad stuff so you would think that this would obviously be a negative review however there actaully is a lot of good stuff as well.  Mainly in terms of the actual gameplay which I feel is what matters most.  2k has fixed a lot of the cheese from previous years and I really do feel like the game plays a lot smoother now and all of the animations look a lot better.  The high school and college games are actually done extremley well even though you dont get to play many games.  There is a lot of little details that they took the time to add that really add to the realism of the high school and college games.  You also have a lot more options to customize your player.  The practice mode and the other options of how to spend your off days is a really nice touch except for the fact that the practice mode is stuck in a side view camera that you cannot change (2k PLEASE FIX THIS) which makes some of the drills pretty much unplayable.  I also really like that you have the ability to see contracts from 3 different teams and try to haggle with them to get more vc and minutes.  Another thing I will add is that, in my opinion, the music in this game is a lot better than in previous 2k games.All in all, there is a lot of bad in this game but I do think 2k pulled through where it really matters which is in the actual gameplay.  And I think that the gameplay is actually so much better than every other 2k game that it makes up for the storyline cheese which is why I gave it a positive review.

content:
r 1, 2015
												OVERVIEW:Graphics: 10/10Gameplay: 8/10MyCareer: 3/10MyPark: 8.5/10MyGM: N/ASTORY A.K.A MYCAREERWhat a story. Not. You don't get to play every game which is a huge negative (not sure how it was in other NBA games, but that's a big turn off). You only get to play eight games in your rookie season. I mean, what? Sorry? Nah, get outta here. Three quaters of the time I was on the bench, too. The actual 'storyline' wasn't too long either. However, the overall story was, how can I say it? Average. I've seen better stories, but I've also seen worse.As for the gameplay - top notch, can't fault it. I lag a little bit because of my specs, though. Anyone with good enough specs should be able to play this game at a high frame-rate no problem.Being as MyCareer is a big part of the game, I'm giving this game a negative review because it didn't stand up to expectations and could have been improved a lot more. The creative teams need to think long and hard to improve it for 2K17. However, everything else runs alright. What I have noticed & encountered are a lot of cheaters online. Which, again, is a big put off. If you want it just to play occassionaly, such as quick games and whatnot - go ahead. For the story? I wouldn't buy it after playing it. But hey ho.

												I love the 2k series but I'm seriously considering not buying for PC next season if at all. First of all this release is extremely unstable and as usual 2k is slow to fix the bugs. I've been dealing with framerate issues from launch. They've patched it and now the issues seems to be isolated to playing career mode where the game fluxuates from running fine to speeding up to slowing down. I've tried playing the game with all of the graphical settings on low and I'm seeing the same results. Aside from the technical issues, I wasn't very happy with the opeing of career mode either. Going from high school to college then the NBA was cool but being forced to watch Spike Lee's preach story was not. I was forced to watch a 20 minute cutscene that I couldn't skip or pause? Ridiculous. I feel that the story had a good moral but came off as forced and preachy. Not to mention the game features another stereotypical portrayal of an Italian American with questionable character that Spike Lee is now becoming known for. I as an African American male can't support all of his views.On the gameplay front, 2K is still top notch. Controls are again improved. Excellent game on that count. However I'm hoping that another developer starts making A+ basketball games as 2K hasn't been forced to step it up since they have no competition. They need to stop releasing unfinished products.

content:
, 2016
												Being a huge Basketball fan I gotta say this game is a real disapointment, 2k really needs to take out there earbuds and just listen to the fans feedback and maybe they will be able to make something worth while. As you can see I played this game for over 100 hours which shows you my love for Basketball and lemme tell you a few of the many problems I've encountered. One some of the shots in this game is ridiculous, Playing as Michael Jordan he missed 12 out of the 20 shots he took in the game and all of his shooting attributes are over 90 which just adds to the ridiculousness. Also playing as Allen Iverson (the god of Ankle Breaking) he hasn't broken ankles barely at all no matter how many dribble moves I do. And don't get me started on the Small Forward and the Layups in this game, Even on Pro (Medium Difficulty) the opposing players play as if it were the playoffs, It's near impossible to get pass the defense hence you have to shoot 3 or mid shooters and like I said before they will miss easy even if you are WIDE OPEN and have a 90+ overall at shootings and even if you get a near perfect release, I man heck I missed a few even with a Perfect Green Release. Not only are these the issues but the game crashed a lot and I have a Windows 10 Alien Ware so I should be good. MyCareer is not as good as last year although there are some good aspects to it. If you try to send a ticket to 2k support they will mostly likely tell you the same thing they tell everyone else, Verify the Cache or redownload the game. All in all the 2k support service is trash. Now that I got that out of the way lemme get to the Pros. The graphics are amazing 2k does really well at graphics and there are a lot of things you can do such as play as a bunch of classic teams and players such as Jabbar and MJ. Really that's all the good stuff I can think of off the top of my head. All in all in conclusion the Cons outways the Pros and as you can see from the reviews above from User Reviews people will probally agree. I suggest you get 2k15 or just wait for 2k17.
