												The actual gameplay for this game is alright, almost great. So if you just want to shoot some hoops with a friend this is a nice sports game. However, if you care at all about the game delivering on its promises in any actual game mode besides quick matches, you'll be disappointed.Street - Sure, as long as you don't mind just walking around watching other people playing. You won't actually get to play any games, since as soon as you queue up, everyone else will leave, because they don't want to play with your low ranked scrub. If someone actually takes pity on you, get ready for the bashing of your life, seeing as your skills are probably mid stat and everyone else is maxed out. So time to open your wallet, pay good money and max out your character, wait another 20 minutes to even get into a game, lose anyway since everyone else also bought game potions.ProAm - I still haven't figured out how this works. As far as I can see it has the same tedious problems as Street - this is just a 5 man version.You character will still suck. And you'll have to wait 30 minutes or so to fill up all slots to get the game going. 2K advertises this as a game mode where you can create your own team where there is an actual ranking, but to my knowledge you won't get anywhere near actually playing as your custom team unless you bring 4 friends.Career - The "Spike Lee joint" part is ridiculous. 2K tries to feed you a storyline and crams in all kinds of characters that are supposed to add immersion. It does just the opposite. I have no idea why my white 5'8 geek was raised in an african-american family in Brooklyn. Nor why he speaks with the deep voice of a 7' giant. I mean, I get cut scenes where my stepmom (well, you explain it!) explains how she met my stepdad... and this is supposed to immerse me how exactly? How you perform in high school makes no difference. What college you choose makes no difference. How you perform during your rookie season makes no difference. Then onto your first real season playthrough. And chances are big you'll finish dead last in your conference. Make a trade, the sooner the better. For me, I still thought my team had a fighting chance of making the playoffs, so I stayed on until it was too late. Then came the last season game and after that - Boom! Next season. I didn't get to see how the playoffs went, no awards, no summary, nothing. Oh well, atleast I can request a trade now? Nope! You need to play 10 games the next season first. Oh, so is that like an NBA rule? I'll just sim through the first ten matches. No, no. You actually have to play 10 matches. The fu....? So I'm stuck on this roster for ten more games? I'll just sim through the rest of the season, maybe some other team will take an interest in me. Not going to happen, silly... Now you're back at the start of a new season on the same crappy roster. Only now, your popularity on the trade boards have gone from 100% to 10-15%.MyTeam - *Uninstalls game...*

content:
r 24, 2015
												If you're interested in simulation basketball, this game runs a mean fast break on all previous iterations -- I'm talking New Jersy Nets Gerald Green head above the rim alley oop windmill dunk. Gone are the days of the ubiquitous jack-of-all-trades superstars. More than ever, the basketball IQ of the person behind the controller matters, and I welcome that. Sure, some cheaters still exist, but, if you learn at least part of the art of basketball, it's not a forgone conclusion that you'll lose.Despite the backlash against MyCareer mode this year, it's an enjoyable mode with a storyline that can be forgotten entirely after your rookie season. In fact, from the second season forward, this mode is probably the most in-depth and satisfying career mode in any sports game. If you're considering buying this game, don't listen to those who wished for the moon and were delivered a game rooted in great basketball mechanics.There are so many modes in this game (I'll let you read about them elsewhere) that any basketball fan should be able to find something they like.

content:
r 6, 2015
												Great game, very different from the past releases. They have completely remodeled the defense making it a lot harder to just zig zag through the cpu's defense which means you have to really work hard for those shots. Also passing is different with new controls and animations and with the new defense some passes are you may have used to do are a lot harder leading in several turnovers They have added a lot more gameplay animations blocks are more realistic, player movements are alot better with faster reaction times. Each player also has their own way of playing. Also body animations are added such as flexing playing with their mouth guard, dunk face animations, gum chewing, etc.The rating system makes more sense this year even though some of you may disagree they are doing it by comparing the players ability to the greatest in that area like for example the best avg rebounder is Dennis Rodman so he has a 99 OFF and 95 DEF in rebounding compared to a current dominating rebounder with DeAndre Jordan who is given a 92 OFF and 94 DEF and same goes for other attributes so if you dont like it, no one cares.MyCareer also has the Spike Lee storyline which has lots of mixed feelings. I just want to mention in my opinions stop b*tching just cause yoour family is black, there are countless games that I've played where I'm given a family that looks nothing like me as a created player and like many others we dont complain we just play and enjoy what they give us. Also they'd need more voice actors which would be too expensive for something they're just trying out.Any way in MyCareer you now have offdays where you get to do either connections (haging out with someone in the leauge such as player, teamowner, celeb) where you get rewards like VC or my favourite you get to pick your game day jersey. Also there's training on off-days for attribute boosts and Endorsments that also give VC. So those are all your choice. Only problem I have with it is you play 3 HS games and 4 College no VC games but are fun and only 8 rookie season games while I would prefer having the whole rookie season to play.MyGm has been redesigned and is more realistic with team relocation added.My Team added several new things like player cards that attributes change as the season goes by with their performance. I may missed some stuff but if this hasn't made you want the game, I don't know what will.So if you want the best NBA... No, a sports game of all time. Here it is.Well till 2K releases something better anyway.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 24, 2016
												This game is terrible. I can't describe it any other way.Granted, I am a very casual gamer so maybe I don't have the patience required for this game but there are so many things wrong with it.Cons-Career mode is a joke. Your player is so bad it's not even fun. Misses 75% of his shots, can't shoot freethrows, it's just aweful. -Constant UI lag. I don't know what's wrong with this game, but it seems like everything you do is horribly slow. Press the X button for a jump shot and your player will travel for almost no reason (like a player can't do a jump shot on the move or something?). Release the shooting button on time and you'll actually be late (falling down or away once you release) for again no reason. This is not a Specs Issue either, I'm running a machine with specs much higher than recommended. -Game is just horrible with Steam Controller, I couldn't recommend playing in this manner to anyone. The dunk stick just dosn't work right because Steam had to be different and go with some sort of scroll pad.-Learning Curve is too high for casual players. I'll do a simple pick and role and the player will just pass to someone else. How stupid is that? I call for a pick and roll and go to pass, and the player kicks it out to someone on the wing who's being guarded...game is so poorly designed in this regard. -Driving to the basket is unneccesarily difficult. The game actuallly punishes you for not running designed plays and maintaining a certain tempo about your play. In real life (I have NBA league Pass) these players would not miss the chances I create in the game when driving to the basket. Yet I almost nearly always miss when driving to the hoop. I also cannot shoot 3's because the shooting command on Steam Controller is delayed or something. I tap X to shoot and the player releases the ball a milisecond before coming back down to the floor. Like the type of real-life shot a player would make as he's getting fouled near the basket. Complete garbage.-Passing is also not right. I can't tell you how many times I move out to the wing and try to pass directly to the center who's got some space and the ball gets picked off in a manner that isn't consisten with the physics of basketball. Again, the game is designed to force you to play a certain way and you cannot simply work around that. -The substitute menu freezes often and interferes with what would be the bounce pass or B button on my controller (configurations vary). It causes me to have to restart, in which case I generally just turn off the game.Overall I don't have the patience to learn to be good at this game and I think it's a horrible waste of time and money.
